review_body: If you are looking for a Hotel that provides airport-hotel service, is less than three minutes from the Inari subways station then this is the Hotel to stay in. I stayed for a total of fifteen days and found it the most value for money place. My double room had a decent size bed and work place, excellent bath/toilet facilities all separate, a good sized TV and excellent lighting the last being very important as it allows you to relax and work without strain. Best of all it has a small kitchenette and the entire staff is friendly, helpful and willing to assist. It has a decent Restaurant serving good steaks and large burgers. Highly recommended.!!!

Decent hotel very near Haneda airport. Provides a free shuttle both ways. But frequency is Long, free wifi is decent in the hotel. There are convenient stores nearby for the mid night snack. Else nothing much in the surrounding area. Good for a one night stay near the airport.

Stayed here for one night while going through Japan and booked family room. The staff was very friendly and rooms was very nice. Th hotel offers free shuttle to and from HND which is a big plus. Downtown is little far but plenty of option to go back and forth. I would highly recommend this place for short stays.

Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We were only here for a night as it was close to the airport for our early morning flight. We booked a large family room for 4 - the room was great. Beds were comfortable and nice having a choice of pillows and provision of pyjamas was an added bonus - that was a nice touch. Just enough room for our 4 large suitcases after a long trip. The bathroom was small but adequate. Not a lot of choice for dinner nearby, but we managed to stumble upon a local yakitori-style Izakaya at the end of one of the side streets. Excellent choice of convenience stores nearby. Very glad to have the free shuttle bus to Haneda but it only operates during certain hours. But taxi to the airport wouldn't cost too much. Staff were helpful and facilities were fine. Would happily stay here again in the future.

A very good hotel close to the International terminal of Haneda Airport. They provide regular transportation from and to the Airport. They are very accommodating for odd hours check in. However the standard check out time is at 10:30 am. You have to add on an extra day if your flight in the afternoon or evening.

We had the last night of our trip here before leaving Tokyo. We had booked dinner near Shibuya and easily managed to get to central Tokyo on the trains so that was super. As a family of 4, we had booked 2 twin rooms. When we went to our rooms we realised they had an interconnecting door. I went to reception to request the opening of the door as a special handle was needed. My initial request was met with ‘no we are sorry we cannot do this’. When I asked why I was told because we hadn’t booked interconnected rooms?! I then politely engaged in further conversation explaining that this would be extremely convenient for our family and they did end up doing so but told me next time I must request it in our booking. I found this a little odd - but was delighted that it was eventually done as this made our stay much more comfortable.

Stayed as a family of four for a total of five nights in two separate segments thos trip. The property is a five minute walk from the Anamori-Inari station and very close to Haneda Airport The hotel has a complimentary shuttle bus service that runs between the hotel, domestic and international terminals of Haneda airport – but it only runs during specific hours. The other options are to hail a cab (should cost around 1,100 yen) or take the subway.Our double room was small, and decor and styling again was bland. But the room was clean and looked modern. The hotel is located in a quiet area, and there are at least a dozen small diners and restaurants sprinkled around the hotel. And that’s not also counting the ubiquitous convenience stores too, of which there are three you'd walk past to/fro subway stop and hotel: a 7-11, a Family Mart, and a Lawson.There are in-house laundry facilities – washer and dryer – and are free to use.Beware: this is an ‘eco’ hotel i.e. there is no daily house-keeping. You’d need to pay extra if you want that.In-room Internet access was reliable and speedy; no issues at all in this regard.In all, this was a satisfactory stay and we had no issues with recommending this property to visitors who need to stay near the airport.

Is near to Haneda Airport and the train station, so it's very convenient to access to many places. The level of cleanliness in this hotel is really great and full of great hospitalities. The receptionists are very kind and helpful in all aspects, and they are able to communicate in English.

I like the fact that it was only 10 minutes from airport. Breakfast was so so. Room was clean and they provide pajamas and toothbrush and toothpaste so that was cool. Toilet seat was heated and that was different but appreciated.

Pros:- Very close to Haneda airport- Free shuttle between hotel and airport provided- Room is not too small- Conveniently located near a train stationCons:- The toilet had a smell which probably came from the pipes

We arrived after midnight and were greeted by a very nice young man who was very polite and helpful. The room was bigger than a lot of hotel rooms in Japan, the air con was nice, the room was clean, the bathroom was small but that is not unusual for Japan. Beds are generally hard but this one had hard pillows as well not that comfortable, but thats how it is in Japan. We had breakfast more a Japanese style breakfast but enough western food to get by. We got the shuttle bus back to the airport just a 10 minute ride.

Arrived to attend the rugby, the welcome was very good and the room was perfect for my needs, staff helpful and very courteous, helped with directions to sights that I wanted to visit, very near to the airport and central location meant it was easy to get to a great deal of places, overall experience was excellent and would definitely recommend, many thanks to all staff for a most enjoyable experience, hope to visit again in the near future,

Good:- Location, 10 mins transfer to Int. Terminal, and 5 mins walk to metro station- Very Clean- Staff very friendly and helpfulBad:- Beds very uncomfortable- Air Conditioning positioned above the bed so its noisy and blasts in your face.- I had a road facing roam, so was quiet noisey, along with noise in the corridor.

We thoroughly were surprised by the size of the rooms, the amenities and the wonderful friendly service . Fabulous value and I highly recommend . The free shuttle runs every 20 minutes to Haneda airport. Lovely breakfast buffet

This is the best place I've stayed in the neighborhood near Haneda Airport. It is a very quiet area with limited dining options, although there are a few convenience stores nearby. The hotel has a shuttle service which is wonderful if you have a late-night arrival after the trains stop running. The Keikyu Line is also a short walk away.The room was spacious and the bed was comfortable (bathroom was a cramped plastic toilet/bath combo typical of business hotels in Japan). I wouldn't choose this as a base for visiting the sights of central Tokyo, though. The only appeal of the neighborhood is its proximity to the airport.

Business hotel rooms a re small in Tokyo and this hotel is no different but an ok size. Not much space inside to open your bag but with a central desk to work.Room has some amenities, kettle, tea, coffee. Bed was comfy. Bathroom was small but well organized with a hair drier. Amenties are available however there are some items you can get at the reception upon check in. Shower has a good power. There are some restaurants in the surroundings, a supermarket and cafes. Convenient for late night arrivals or early morning flights. It is less than 10min from the Haneda airport and there is a shuttle bus in the AM and PM.

Offered the basics and didn’t disappoint. Had a problem with faulty air conditioning in the room, hotel tried to resolve and then moved us to different room with minimum of fuss. Beds were comfortable. Hotel has many facilities which we didn’t utilise but could observe. Relatively close to train station

We booked this hotel because it was our last night and we wanted to be close to the airport. Upon arriving we found out they have free shuttle bus to the airport leaving every 20 minutes how awesome is that. The room were spacious and really comfortable bed. If we knew we would’ve stayed here first. Great value and awesome service.Ps. They even have a rice cooker in the room!!! What !! Awesome!!

We stayed here after a late arrival to Haneda airport. This hotel did not disappoint. Reasonable size room. Close to train station and restaurants and conscience stores. Enjoyed the Japanese breakfast and the staff were friendly and helpful! Thankyou for making our stay easy!

We stayed here for our first night in Japan since we arrived at 23:00. There was a shuttle bus that takes you to the hotel so that was a plus. The rooms are a good size for couples. Ours included a desk, couch, tv and bed. The breakfast was a buffet and since we were jetlagged and up early we were able to beat the morning rush. There is a train station a block or two away with a few hole in the wall restaurants (we didn't get to try any because they don't open until afternoon-ish). Staff were very helpful with directions and suggestions on what to see. Definitely worth staying at. Plus the price was under $100 usd

Nice bedroom and clean. But bathroom smelt like rotting drain water. Pay 16 bucks extra each for breakfast, everything was empty or cold. I imagine this is what prison food is like. And we turned up an hour and half before breakfast ended. When I spoke to staff they started clearing the empty bowls but not replacing with fresh/warm food. So anyway we are hungry and annoyed, and we paid $32 for that luxury.

Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights prior to a cruise. Enjoyed the fact that it was outside of Tokyo and very quiet as we were there in Golden week and the city was crazy!!The room although rather small was adequate for our needs. Had most everything you need including complimentary phone chargers. Only tea provided, no coffee. We arrived very early after 2 x7hour flights from Australia and were extremely tired. Check in was 3pm!!! We asked if we could access the room earlier but was told there was a charge prior to 3pm. We managed to last until 12pm and due to needing sleep relented and paid 60 yen- 20 yen per hour for early access. This I thought was quite unreasonable considering the fact that the room was ready. On the plus side the laundry was free, there is a market, pharmacy, bakery and great little restaurants close by. Train station within 5 minute walk also.

You have to remember the rooms in Japan are small and this one was on the large side, very comfy, big bathroom, sound system, fairly long way from elevator but the room was clean, all the fancy buttons on the toilet seat as you get in Japan, nice amenities like soap gel, shampoo, conditioner, it was a quiet room and the reception staff spoke English and were very helpful, they have a shuttle bus to the airport which is 10 minutes away.

This a good hotel to stay with if you have a morning flight out of Haneda airport they have a free shuttle to the airport but you cannot book a seat first come system we had a standard queen non smoking room it’s comfortable but small and breakfast is ok

Pros -1. Love the toilet - even provide lather net for scrubbing body. Fragrant toiletries. High tech toilet bowl. Good shower pressure2. Queen bed - just enough for 2 adults and 2 young children3. Breakfast spread is sufficient with choices of international and Japanese4. Near airport for late night arrivals or early morning stays - taxi fare 1200 yen5. Free shuttle bus to Haneda airport in the morning 6. Clean room 7. Looks new Cons -Only stayed for half a day, didn’t find any faults with the hotel. Value for money. Highly recommended. I will stay here again in future if I have any late night arrivals or early flights.

Stayed 1 night - Couples stay with standard King bed, wish it were more. The location is very ideal being very close to the airport, I had luggage transfer from Osaka the day prior and when checking in was told my belongings were already in my room. Fantastic! There is a Lawsons and 7 eleven about a 2 minute walk away or the cafe/restaurant in the hotel. Staff are very helpful and have a good amount to English. The room was bigger than you will normally get in Japan, so that was a massive bonus. Very clean and comfortable bedding, Bathroom is well equipped with amenities though there are items you can take from the supply in the lobby, lotion shower cap etc. Check in at 0300 giving us time for a quick site see of the city by rail - about a 3 minute walk to station. Free bus transfer between 0500 & 1000 from what I can remember, but everyone is so friendly and helpful. Would stay again. Thank you!

We had an overnight stay for an early morning flight. Great location close to Haneda Airport. Modern, comfortable clean rooms. Requested a large bed and got it. Bathroom easy to move around in. Breakfast disappointing and expensive.

Excellent hotel for one night, providing free shuttle bus from and to airport ( shuttle bus from hotel to airport only in the morning, last departure at 10 am). Very confortable clean rooms, good breakfast with vegetarian options.

Modern clean hotel excellent for a airport stopover. As a family of four we booked a quadruple room which was more than sufficient and very comfortable. There is a wide range of bars and restaurants within a ten minute walk.The hotel provides a free airport shuttle bus for early departures which departs the hotel every twenty minutes with a journey time to the international terminal of approximately ten minutes. Overall a very comfortable hotel which is good value for money.

This is a great hotel if you are arriving at Haneda late and need a good night sleep. It is minutes away from Haneda terminal 1. As with most MyStays hotels, great comfort and service. This hotel is near the monorail with only 22 minutes travel to Tokyo station.

건물자체는 오래된 느낌인데도 청소가 무척 잘되어 깨끗하구요 대부분의 일본 호텔처럼 직원도 무척 친절합니다 조식은 안먹었는데 까페같은 분위기라 나쁘지 않아 보였어요 지하철역에서 오분정도 걸어야 되는 거리고 가격도 합리적입니다 Just like so many of the hotels in japan, extremly helpful staffs, very clean room even though the building itself looks quiet old, and very reasonable price

Caught Keikyu Aiport subway from Haneda to the Anamori-Inari stop (#14) and maybe a 4-5 min walk, straight out station & left to main road & then right, will see hotel. Make sure you take the subway that stops at each station or you will go past this stop to stop #11 like we did and had to backtrack. Your can find information on their website or email.Nice hotel & lobby, check-in smooth, Hollywood twin, view of street, 2 double beds, desk chair, end tables, fridge TV, kettle/tea, fully stocked bathroom, pyjamas, slippers, room safe, more bathroom amenities at front desk. We were close to the airport & our room faced the street but it was quiet. They have a restaurant but we did not try. There are 2 Family Marts close by and a handful of restaurants plus past the station is a very small supermarket with fruit and veg.Their complimentary Haneda airport shuttle operates late day (after 6 pm) and early morning and other options are taxi or train. We took the 8 am shuttle to Haneda and there were seats to spare. Overall, newer hotel, nice place and would stay again if needed a place near Haneda for a night or two.

Stayed here with a friend for a night as our arrival time was late (10:30pm arrival) so we decided to stay somewhere close to rest. This hotel offers Free shuttle from airport - ask info desk at airport to go to the “Chartered bus” area. Bus was frequent enough so we didn’t wait too long. The ride was about 10-15min. Room size is decent with a TV, work station and mini fridge and single sofa. There’s a kettle for hot water and hair dryer. The surprise is the face wash and cream offered at the lobby (see pictures). As my luggage was lost and I didn’t have any toiletries with me, I’m pleasantly surprised that there’s facial wash, toner, cream, etc etc in additional to those normal ones that you expect (toothbrush, comb, etc).There’s a family mart 3 min away on foot to get some midnight snacks or less than 10 min away from sukiya a 24 hour restaurant.Nearest train station is about 10min away on foot anamori inari station. We took the train from there to our next hotel in Shinjuku which takes about 45min and ¥440. There are other options to go to Shinjuku with different prices too.

Tucked away in a private location and very nice. The rooms are all super clean and whats really awesome is our room came with a cell phone to use locally. I didn't have to use any of my international data and it was 100% free.

Clean and relatively spacious. The complimentary use of pajamas was a nice touch. Hotel can consider providing a simple free breakfast. Travellers should note that 1) the hotel shuttle bus stop at the airport is not easy to find due to renovations at haneda airport (follow the airline crew, it is the same bus stop as the airline crew pick up point) and 2) seats on the early morning (5 - 6 am) shuttle buses from the hotel to the airport will be filled up quickly, so do arrive 15 mins before the bus' scheduled departure.

Booked a last minute room so that I didn’t risk a lengthy commute to the airport for my flight. Arrived early and dropped bags then caught a subway train. Hotel room was clean, comfortable and had all amenities. Staff were friendly and breakfast was great! Free shuttle to the airport was very useful too. Would stay again!

Stayed 2 nights before flying home in this comfortable hotel that is well geared up for airport users.nBooked larger room and found this v comfortable with well equipped bathroom although no separate wardrobe. Double bed big enough for us (I am 1m98). Charging cables for iPad and micro usb provided as well as mini speakers! Staff as always v welcoming. Didn't use restaurant but good looking breakfast served from 5 am. Got shuttle at 6.20 am - it's first come first served and fits about 15 people and luggage - if you miss it, it's only 5 mins from Anamori Inari station which is 2 stops from the airport but also good for getting to central Tokyo.

It is very nice hotel with convenient location near Haneda airport. Easy access via Keikyu Line saves your time when transit to another city. Hotel is surrounded by many restaurants offering different meal. If you need a rest and do not want to leave hotel the Travel Cafe at the ground floor provides a la carte. Besides is suggested delicious breakfast. Staff is skilled and kind. Hotel provides free shuttle bus to Haneda airport.

Fairly new hotel, rooms are a reasonable size and value for money. Very clean and facilities are good. Only 4 or 5 minutes from the nearest metro station and easily reached - turn left out of the station and right when you reach the top of the road. Few eating options nearby however, though there is a restaurant in the hotel with a choice of Western food which we did not use so cannot comment. Breakfast was quite good with a range of Japanese and the usual bacon and scrambled egg options for Westerners. We asked for a quiet room and we were on the 4th floor from the lift so it was fine. The only complaints would be that the AC remote control was in Japanese and no English instructions - a problem in every hotel in Japan that we stayed in. The pillows were hard also . The airport shuttle service is efficient though at limited times : operates to the airport in the morning till 9.30 or so and from the airport late at night, reservations not possible so this might be an issue for people. There are other several other hotels in the area if shuttle service is a priority. It is easy enough to take the metro however even with luggage - only the next stop at a cost of 290 yen per person. We would stay here again.

We stayed here for one night as our flight arrived late at night and we had a flight out in the morning, it was a nice clean comfortable hotel it’s not very big but adequate for the one night, and it was nice and quiet,

A good hotel for a short stay or layover. It is very close to Haneda, Tokyo International Airport and the hotel operates a shuttle service to and from the airport. Be aware that the airport shuttle bus tends to get very busy during the morning rush hour. The rooms are fairly clean and have all the essentials. Every room has an individual air-conditioning unit rather than a centrally operated system which works really well. The beds are comfortable enough but the pillows could be better. There is a restaurant onsite and also a lot of convenience stores and supermarkets in the vicinity of the hotel. Be careful while getting into- and out of the bathroom as there is a step that is easily missed and can get you badly injured should you trip. Overall a good hotel and would not mind using them again.

room 431: We booked last minute for one night stay, due to transfer issues at Haneda airport. Some staff had lots of difficulty understanding English. Superior. double with kitchenette. room was neat but very tight due to poor design with too much furniture for the space. WiFi was weak at times,, thermostat hard to understand, no English instructions provided upon check in. If you have lots of luggage, you may find it difficult to move around. Location is very good, near train station and several eateries and supermarkets. Shuttle to airport worked well and on time. shuttle from airport times were confusing as airport information staff is also in need of language training. overall if in a crunch, would stay. again but there are tons of other choices in the very nearby area.

Stayed here for one night after a late arrival at Haneda. The airport shuttle is very convenient and drops you off right in front of the hotel. The room was on the ground floor and had kind of a strange layout, however the bed was comfortable enough and the room had a very large desk and lots of charger ports. Check-in and checkout were somewhat perfunctory and I wouldn't base myself here for a longer visit since it is fairly inconvenient to get to most of the central areas of Tokyo. The surrounding neighborhood is dull, but has a few convenience stores and a train station you can use to get back to the airport if the shuttle is full.

The hotel room is nice, clean and functional. Nice place for overnight stay. Close to the airport. The hotel offers free shuttle to the airport in the morning. it is first come first served basis. Convenience stores are close to the area.

We stayed at this hotel our first night and last night in Japan as our arrival and departure flights were at midnight. This is a very ideal hotel to stay at for such a reason. They have wifi and a gym which we used on our last day after eating all the rice and noodles for two weeks. The staff is friendly and can speak English, they have a morning shuttle to take you to the airport for free should you wish. Note this shuttle is only for morning, they don't offer the same service in the evenings. Its close to the airport so catching a cab isn't expensive, 1700 yen, around 20 dollars. The breakfast was also very good.

Rooms are clean & functional but small. That's the norm in Tokyo :( directions for aircon are in Japanese, ask at reception for assistance. Free shuttle from airport to hotel is very handy although it does get rather busy, first come first served basis. If you arrive late at night like we did, there is a convenience store Family Mart around the corner that's open til late for snacks & meals which you can reheat instore. Breakfast is buffet style with good variety of Japanese/Western foods.

travelled with a large tourist groups from China. stayed one night in this hotel before leaving early for a flight.firstly couldnt swing a cat in the room, the room obviously designed for 1 twin bed had 2 x twin beds jammed in the room. barely room to walk around them.As part of the group i was in wanted an early start before our scheduled (not hotel shuttle) bus at 6.00 am. a group went to ask the desk late in the evening whether the hotel could arrange 3 taxis at 5.00 am.the group mostly spoke Chinese, other than my partner who speaks English.the hotel desk peopl quoted 5800 Yen, plus toll fees for ech taxi paid in advance to the front desk.the group thought this was expensive, and then asked me to which i told them not to bother its outrageous!!Dont stay here! if the staff can take advantage of you they will!!!

We stayed here prior to our departure from Haneda airport in late June.Pros- Very quiet- clean and larger than some other hotels we’d stayed in while in Japan- library area nice to visit with others in our group (has vending machines with beer and a microwave too)- very close to the airport - staff was awesome they wrote a nice note when we accidentally left our passports at the desk- restaurant on siteCons- free shuttle has limited options so for our afternoon flight we opted to stay until checkout then call a taxi- while near the airport not too much else was nearby (do visit the shrine nearby, so pretty!)- restaurant on site - skip the pizza it almost seemed microwaved! Everyone else loved their burgers/fries and pasta though.While I probably would opt to stay somewhere else next time - it would be to be near more excitement since the hotel was really nice!

Very easy to get using trains. The room was bigger than expected. Not much but definitely bigger and it did matter. Very nice and helpful reception staff. The only mildly negative thing was the restaurant. All burger photos are with fries in them. In the menu below it says fries are extra 150 yen. I didn't read the whole menu and just ordered a burger. Was a bit surprised when it came without fries. The staff told me it's extra 100 yen so I was again surprised when the bill showed it was actually 150 yen. Very small things just as they say the devil is in the details. Knowing all that I can say that I'd stay here again.

Comfortable place for one night before leaving from Haneda. Room was a little odd, with a pillar in the middle and it was small, but had everything you would need and the bed was comfortable. We got caught out a bit by their shuttle bus, which only runs a few hours in the morning and evening, we flew in on a domestic flight and had to wait for a while until the evening bus started running, would have been nice if the hotel had mentioned the limited times when the booking was made, but generally a good place and just 10 minutes from the International terminal. Restaurant was OK for a simple meal in the evening, not much else around.

This hotel was so fab interms of everything. Our room was not that big BUT literally very comfy, the aircon is cold, clean petit room. So maximize. The only problem is due to the room size, the CR is somewhat small, being an Asian, I already consider it small what more for the western. Good thing also it has free shuttle to & fro Haneda Airport, but be sure to check for the shuttle service schedules. Subway station just around the corner.

I had a morning international flight out of Haneda airport so chose MyStays for the night before. It's a fairly basic hotel but it's also very competitively priced. The rooms are comfortable (although mine had a weird pillar right in the middle of it) and I had a decent night's sleep before an early alarm. The hotel runs a free shuttle to (and from) the airport, though it does fill up quickly, so get downstairs early! The hotel is in a fairly nondescript location so food and entertainment options are limited.

Good location, and comfortable rooms. Our family of four took the shuttle from the international terminal to the hotel but do note that it does not run from the international terminal at all hours - if before 1047pm, you will have to take another airport shuttle to a domestic terminal to get the hotel shuttle from there. Also, do note that if you are a party of 8 or more, the notice at the hotel says that you will not be able to take the shuttle to the airport, so as to allow for more space for other guests. This seems inconvenient, and making a prior booking should allow for this.We had stayed for four nights in 2 MyStay hotels during our trip, and realised that for one of the nights, I had booked the wrong date online from the MyStays official website, but no partial refund or offset to my other nights was possible. For such a large chain, I thought that it could have been more flexible to offer a partial offset to my bill for a genuine mistake, to foster goodwill and repeat business from a loyal customer.

Quiet, clean with restaurant and limited airport shuttle 1 mile away Haneda. Small room but excellent bathroom. Good for 2 people. Fridge in room. Part of an excellent chain.Staff speaks English. Great local eateries within 200 meters at lower prices than in Tokyo. Wonderful temple next door.

We liked our one night stay there before an early departure from Tokyo Haneda airport.Room are beautifully arranged and perfectly clean> WIFI works great, Bathroom is OK. We used the shuttle service which is free very early in the morning. The schedules were respected.

I stayed here overnight, which is perfect because the free shuttle is only about 7 minutes from Haneda airport. The shuttle is super hard to find though, you have to exit the airport, cross the street at the crosswalk and then the stop is behind this partial wall. I only found it because I asked for help. The shuttle was on time and quick. Checkin was fast, given my room promptly with my breakfast buffet ticket because it was included in my rate.My room was the standard semi double and was good for a few hours sleep. The room was clean, but the bathroom smelled funny. I wasn't sure if it was a pee smell or it was cleaned with a dirty mop or something. The bed & pillow are SUPER firm/slightly hard if you aren't used to such a firm mattress. I remember thinking how firm it was while I was sleeping! If you like a comfy bed then this isn't the place for you. The hotel is very quiet though, so it works for the price and connivence to the airport.Breakfast was good, a variety of options and plenty of space, although I was the only one there. It was hot and worked perfectly. The shuttle left on time (which I think is every 30 min). I would recommend this hotel just of the price and the closeness to the airport.

We stayed in this hotel in May 2018 after flying for 11 hrs. Hotel is nice and has shuttle bus from Haneda Airport Bus parking.Hotel has not to small room ( w.r.t. Japan ) and nice continental breakfast

This hotel is good for a night before the airport. It is closely located to that, but not to anything else. Rooms were comfortable enough with good temperature control. Staff was not the nicest but it was ok. I recommend this hotel when coming from haneda.

Title says it all. Exactly what we were hoping for.Check in was smooth, English was very good. Room was spotless.There are quite a few great little local places to eat nearby. Free airport shuttle. Ride to International terminal was less than 10 minutes. Unfortunately, unless one arrives late, one has to transfer to domestic terminals to catch shuttle to the hotel.

Location good, Free hotel shuttle bus only 10 mintues arrive Haneda airport.Room are clean and big , as we are arrived very late from Tokyo centre, just get to show and sleep to cath early morning fight.

Stopped here on the way into and out of Japan. Comfortable and quiet rooms. The shuttle was good - it starts at 4am and finishes about midnight which should cover most flights. If not the international airport is about 5 or 10 minutes in a taxi. The staff were friendly and helpful. There is a JR Line station just around the corner. We ate dinner in the restaurant which was pretty good. I’d stay again if flying into or out of Haneda.

While not actually at the airport, I recommend this spot five minute shuttle ride away. The rooms are comfortable and they have nice toiletries. There is a nice/bar restaurant a few doors day that is a true small neighborhood pub. And there is a nice little temple right around the corner. If you are only laying over for a night (like us), you can at least feel like you did something in Tokyo.

I booked this hotel for it's price and that it offered a free shuttle service to Haneda airport. Upon checking in, I learned that the shuttle only runs until 10am. You cannot reserve a spot on it. It's on a first come basis. The problem is that I don't have to be at the airport before noon. This means that I will have to pay for a taxi. They don't advertise that the service is not 24/7.Otherwise, the room is just fine. This is a hotel for people who need easy access to the airport.

Stayed here for one night before our flight out of Japan. We were given a room on the first floor, close to elevators and foot traffic. When I asked for a change in room, I was told that is the only one for the room type I booked, although my rooms in other parts of Tokyo, Kyoto, Osaka were much better for the same, if not lower price. The reception people were not particularly friendly/helpful.Breakfast was not good, with scrambled eggs very watery and limited other options for a North American. Fortunately we were there for only about 9 hours.

I stayed in January and the hotel was clean and cozy. It is located in a great area with access to markets. Also, close to the subway line which makes it convenient to travel to downtown. The hotel rooms are quite spacious and feature all needed amenities.

One night only. Clean, modern, decent sized twin bed room, quiet and near local shops and restaurants. Efficient check in and out. Used the shuttle to get to the airport at 0620, spare seats on the minibus at that time - a bonus saving the walk back to the station. We ate at local restaurants so can't comment on the food. No negatives at all from us.

No one advised us how to use the shuttle bus from the airport, before the departure.It took about 5 to 10 minutes walk from local line train station. On the walk way you could find some stores (7-eleven, Lawson, Tsuruha Drug... etc.) and restaurants for daily amenities and foods. The area was quiet and comfortable.The hotel had modern facilities. The staff was not impassioned.It was environmental friendly that the daily amenities (mainly for faces and teeth) were collectively provided in the lobby in preference to every room.The room is tidy and clean. The hot water supply is stable. The quality of hand wash, shampoo and body wash were nice. Enough number of hanger. It could be perfect if the room temperature could be warmer.

The is a newer property and we found this after failing to book either of the hotels at Haneda Airport. It is within walking distance to the Anamori-Inari station on the Haneda Airport Line. The hotel provides a free shuttle in the morning to Haneda Airport every 20 minutes on a first come first serve basis. We selected the deluxe family room. Very good size that could easily accommodate 4. In room safe and a fridge is included. The bathroom has a bath tub. And vending machines on every floor. WiFi is free and decent. The bed is just nice with a choice of pillows provided. The property has a restaurant on site although there are also various restaurants outside. Especially as you make your way towards the train station. There is also a gym on level 5 although we didn’t try it. There’s also a laundry room. Clean, comfortable and conveniently close to Haneda Airport. This should be a choice if you have an early flight to catch. A Family Mart convenience store nearby is an another plus. Check in and out were swiftly and efficiently done. We caught the 6:40 am shuttle to the International Terminal and was there by 6:48. It’s a busy airport and we are glad we got there early as there were long lines through security and immigration. And don’t forget to leave your tax free forms at customs between security and immigration.

Very convenient as it’s close to the airport and shuttle bus runs frequent.Rooms rather small but not too bad.Had a room for 2 adults and 2 children.Were given 2 normal and 2 very hard pillows, couldn’t change these hard pillows (like rocks) for normal ones, no extra pillows were given either, very poor service.Would not come back here next time.

Pros :The hotel is close to the Haneda international airport, if your intention is to spend a night before catching an early flight the next day, this hotel is for you. The hotel is very close to train station too, less than 5-minute walk from train station. Free shuttle service provided. Room is small but very clean, comfortable and quiet.Cons :When we arrived hotel and front desk staff had been so rude, no welcome message, no smile, unhelpful upon check-in and arranged at least 10 minutes for the room. Air conditioner has been operating at a steady noise level but suddenly starts making a loud noise. I won’t stay at this one again.

The hotel is conveniently located near the airport. It was clean and had all the basic amenities. The only thing that I found annoying is the miscommunication due to language barrier. I got given the wrong information twice. Also, the check out time is strictly 11-am. Unlike other hotels in different countries that give you an hour or two depending on the availability.This one does not and they will charge you 2000yen per hour. Otherwise, it's a convenient place to stay when you arrive on a late flight.

Very convenient for a late check in. The room is comfortable, good for an overnight stay. They have a shuttle service and also near a train station. The staff is helpful to what we need. I don’t have much time to check what this hotel can offer more but still it left me a good impression.

We stayed here and were very happy with the staff, amenities and lovely breakfast we had before heading off to Haneda Airport to take a trip to Nagasaki. The bonus of a free shuttle to Haneda Airport was fantastic and I would happily stay here again.

We stayed overnight at Mystays Haneda - we had a late evening arrival (10pm) into HND and another flight the next morning at around 11am. The hotel sent out clear instructions showing how to catch their shuttle bus, and with typical Japanese efficiency we were going down the escalator to the bus stop 30secs after a bus was due to leave and of course we could then see the bus pulling off! Make sure you get the right shuttle bus as there are two MyStays hotels with shuttles from the airport.The hotel is just outside the airport area and depending which terminal you board the bus from, it will be 10-20mins to get to the hotel from the airport. Check in was efficient and trouble free, and we were allocated a room at the rear of the ground floor, just opposite the laundry room. This meant the room was towards the rear of the hotel but overlooking the quieter side street rather than the main road at the front. The room felt relatively spacious for a Japanese hotel and had an unusual arrangement of a desk area acting as the headboard for the bed, creating two separate areas to the room. We appreciated that TV had a few international channels, and there were bedside power outlets to charge our phones. Typical "plastic pod" bathroom.We had ordered a pre-paid SIM card and had this sent to the MyStays hotel; I had forgotten to ask about this at check-in, but we found the envelope neatly arranged on the desk. Japanese efficiency!We didn't eat in the hotel resturant, but there was a 24hr noodle bar just a block or so down the street with English menus (turn left out the front door), and of course an obligatory convenience store.Suffering from jetlag, we had an early monring stroll around the few streets just behind the hotel and there's a nice enough shrine you can spend a few minutes looking around, even though it wasn't open when we were there. There's also the local train station on the branch line going to the airport.The shuttle back to the airport was trouble free. We just needed a convenient place to rest overnight in clean and conformable but not luxurious surroundings, and MyStays Haneda gave us what we needed.

Nice clean hotel with good amenties suitable for night stay for late arrival/early departure. Free shuttle to/from the airport is a bonus and one of the reason for choosing this hotel. There are some decent ramen just a block away and family mart is nearby.Do agree with other traveller that the front desk gentlemen are not as welcoming than I expected and I stayed in 3 Mystays properties during this trip.

Recently stayed at this hotel. It’s short walk from metro station. Has regular shuttle service to from airport. The rooms are clean Breakfast is below average with very limited choice. Mainly Japanese breakfast The staff at front desk. Having visited and stayed at many hotels in Japan. I found the gentleman at front desk very cold and not welcoming. First such experience in Japan. But front desk ladies very friendly.

We recently stayed at the Mystays Haneda hotel in Tokyo. Very close to Haneda airport, short walk to subway and trains. Good restaurant in hotel. Clean, efficient and convenient. We chose this place after deciding to fly into Haneda Airport which is newer than Narita and much closer to the city and ground transportation. Cabs are very expensive in Tokyo so wanted to be close to the action.Very happy with our choice.

We decided to stay here for 4 nights as we arrived very late the first night and were leaving around midnight the last day so we wanted something close to the airport.On arrival, we found the shuttle without any trouble after asking at the information desk. Check in was smooth. We were tired as we travelled for over 20 hours so only saw the A4 sheet on the bar advising of the breakfast costing 1200 yen (I did not read the whole sheet). We got up very early the next day due to jet lag and wanted to buy the 1200 breakfast, we were told that this price is only if you buy the voucher day in advance. Price on the day was over 1600 yen! Bear this in mind. There is everything you need in the room, kettle, shower gel, shampoo, soap etc. If you want different amenities, they are provided in the reception. The shower was strong and hot. We took the shuttle to the airport the next day and from there we took a direct bus to Mt. Fuji for a day trip - absolutely loved our day!There are restaurants close by. It was quite a challenge to find something vegetarian but when we walked passed one restaurant in the back street, the owner came out and told me that she will cook anything they have on the menu, but with vegetables, instead of meat - she was great!As the shuttle does not run from the Hotel to the Airport in the evening, we had to take a taxi. The cost was 1300 yen. I would suggest that they provide the shuttle to the airport in the evening also as many flights leave Haneda airport around midnight. All in all we had a good stay and would not hesitate to stay here again.
user_name:
Zabka
Windsor and Maidenhead, United Kingdom

review_body: This was our first time to the Tokyo area and had no idea where to stay that was clean and not expensive. This hotel was perfect for both. The room was small like everything in Japan but it was cute and very clean. It had an area for the bed, area with a table to eat and watch TV and an area to bath etc. all small but very manageable even for 2 people. I stayed alone for 2 of the days and it was perfect for one person. They have a restaurant in the lobby with a great breakfast buffet with American and Japanese options, well worth the $12. They have a library with small couches, laundry, small fitness with few treadmills and place to stretch, room service from the restaurant and my favorite the refresh room that has 2 reclining massage chairs. Best I have ever sat in! The staff could use someone that speaks a bit more English but they can speak enough to figure most things out. Use make sure they understand your question before relying on the answer. Free shuttle to the airport and walking distance close by to markets, restaurants and train station 5 minute walk. Great location and all in all a wonderful small hotel. I would stay there again for sure. If traveling alone as a women it’s perfect!

Arrived 11pm, so using the hotel made life stress free. Walk straight out of customs and follow charter bus signs down some steep stairs to the bus. 20 mins later you are in bed.Next day a 5 minute very enjoyable walk to the train line, straight into Ginza and our next hotel.Service from all staff including the driver was excellent. English spoken at reception .

Location of this hotel was perfect as we were flying out of Haneda the following morning. Food options around the hotel were not great, but decent. The hotel itself was clean, had all the amenities and very nice customer service. Laundry facilities were also great! Having the free shuttle bus to the airport was also very important and very nice to have!

I chose to stay in this hotel on arrival into Haneda as we were landing late and I did not fancy travelling into Tokyo at that time. The only issue we had was working out where to find the shuttle service.After travelling round the airport terminals to find the hotels transfer bus, we arrived in the hotel in good time and were welcomed with smiles and quickly checked in. While the rooms are small, they are well priced, very convenient with helpful staff. This hotel is also very conveniently placed in terms of convenient stores for snacks and meals. I highly recommend this hotel for those with early starts and late arrivals.

Free shuttle from airport - around 15 mins transfer. 10 mins walk from nearest metro station into city. Rooms were small but very clean with crisp, clean sheets and small Japanese style bathrooms. Breakfast was around 900 yen per person and was ok, not a massive choice but fair and had western food and tiny toasts.Reception was welcoming and helpful. No problem staying again.

We spent 3 days in Tokyo and decided to stay into a hotel close to Haneda airport. Hotel is offering shuttle bus from the airport, however is also well connected through public transportation to the airport (train station just around the corner). We arrive in the morning before check inn time, but we can take the room only 2 hours in advance if paying extra 50 Euro. The staff was very nice and explain the situation and offering a resting room to avoid extra payment until the check inn time. Appreciate the staff availability to offer different options. We end up with the extra payment option because of jetlag. Since reception hotel offers extra amenities including cleansing oil, tonner etc...) Rooms are decent large for a Japanese standard offering also pyjamas along with other usual amenities Close to hotel is a small restaurant where you can find western food at good prices. Also in the hotel vicinity are local restaurants and on the way to train station there are small shops if you need something. In the morning I could see with my own eyes some Lean Sigma principles applied into a hotel cleaning process... really amazed. The cleaning standards are one of the highest seen in the hotels... Highly recommended for a stay in Tokyo

This is the only hotel i've slept in while visiting Tokyo but it did not disappoint. My friend and I got a room there and it was a great location... short walk to the train... free shuttle bus to the airport... clean and classy amenities... You can help yourself to the toiletries in the lobby, which is a bonus. They provide pajamas and slippers. The pillows are plush. Great sleeping space! Would stay there again.

Very clean. Comfortable beds. There is room for washing and drying and the small restaurant has a nice western friendly menu (I love japanese food but my kids are incredibly difficult) It is close to train station (about 30-40 minute to get to city center area).This is a four star rating for a simple hotel near the airport. Perfect if you have an early flight but would not stay here for more than one night.Room not available before checkout time. You will need help to get the AC working. Ask for someone to come to your room as even the manual was hit and miss.We were a family of five so we got two rooms with two double beds. Not huge but it worked. Having three kids in Asia is not common in any way.Wifi speeds were very good for streaming Netflix and Youtube.For dinner, we ordered pizza with Dominoes Pizza... it worked with a foreign credit card!If you take the shuttle, remember that the 6 am one is popular, get there early or plan for the previous or latter one.

We had a 16 hour layover in Tokyo and decided we wanted to explore a little and have a rest before our next flight leg so we chose the Hotel Mystays Haneda for 1 night. This hotel location was perfect! Very close to the Haneda Airport.... maybe a 10 min drive, mostly due to traffic. Check in was easy and the desk reception spoke English very well! Thankfully since our combined Japanese is little to none. The room was a decent size in my opinion and VERY clean. They even provide slippers & pyjamas should you need them! Oh, and if you forgot any toiletries there is a unit in reception that held a whole bunch of free items should you require. The bathroom had the usual shampoo, conditioner and body wash and even toothbrush and toothpaste. The beds were very comfortable, though the pillows were a little on the hard side. For just one night, this was not a big deal. There is a restaurant in the lobby, but we did not use it. If you want to travel into town, there is a train station that is literally around the corner from the hotel so that was very convenient too since uber was approx $75-100 depending on the time of day from Ota to Shibuya. The trains maps are a bit daunting, but with a little patience and a little asking of the station staff... who are also very helpful.... we made it into and back from Shibuya quite easily. Come morning the hotel also offers a shuttle to the airport at a first come first serve basis starting at 4:00 for the International terminal. Get down to the lobby at least 10-15 min before you need to head to the airport to get a seat. Highly recommend this hotel for a short and pleasant stay if in Tokyo.

My wife and I stayed here for three nights and enjoyed the service. It was in a quiet part of Tokyo and we felt away from the rush. We had a large room with microwave, rice cooker, and kettle so we were able to make some meals. The restaurant has a breakfast buffet but the lunch and dinner menus are not that exciting.

Very friendly staff. Hotel restaurant isn't huge but has a wide, delicious selection of food. Laundry on site. Rest rooms on each floor with drinks machine, microwave, sofas, games consoles. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Have a kettle, tv and fridge (CNN is only English language channel). Fast and free wifi. Shuttle bus takes people to Haneda airport which is about 20 mins walk. A bit of a pain to get into Tokyo. Options are walk 5 mins to Anamori and take the Keikyu railway into Shinagawa changing at Keikyu Kamata (be careful it's easy to get on the wrong train!!) and then change at Shinagawa for the Subway. Other option (which I prefer) is walk 5 - 10 mins to Tenkubashi monorail and take Monorail to Hammamasutcho and change for subway. Beware coming back, make sure you take the local monorail which stops at Tenkubashi! Both take about the same time; monorail option slightly cheaper and has one less change.

Convenient hotel located just a few minutes from the airport. There's a shuttle service which made transport a breeze. The rooms are typically small (standard for Japan), but the wifi works great and the staff were all very friendly and helpful. I'd stay here again.

Well priced, clean and comfortable hotel with a free shuttle bus to Tokyo Haneda airport. The food in the downstairs cafe was good too. A pleasant surprise were the two massage chairs located on floor 4 which are free to use.

We stopped for a short night after a domestic flight into Haneda, and before an international flight out of Haneda the next morning. The hotel is modern, smart; the rooms are well equipped and comfortable. The staff are professional and keen to assist. The shuttle bus too and from Haneda worked great - easy to find, prompt, efficient. The location is basically perfect. Really close to the airport. There's a 7-11 nearby, and some good restaurants too. The rooms are quiet, which is a bonus. It really is a good overall package. Not a hotel for sightseeing / being near the city centre - but perfect for Haneda.

I was there for 3 nights and had a comfortable stay. My room was small, especially the bathroom, but it worked. Internet service was good, and the room had a hot water maker for coffee/tea/soup. There is a restaurant in the hotel lobby with western & Japanese offerings, and there are lots of restaurants and fast food choices within walking distance. Location is excellent. One can even walk to the Haneda Airport terminal, but hotel also provides a free shuttle on a regular basis.

This is a great hotel not far from Haneda Airport. They have a convenient shuttle bus between MyStays and the airport. There is a nice restaurant on 1st floor and room service until 10pm. Two convenient stores are within a few minutes of walking.Nice design, and lovely bath.

Hotel is close to Haneda Airport with free shuttle in morning and night. Room size is reasonable in Asia with coffee and tea marker. Hotel is very clean, even with free self-serve laundry. Have breakfast in hotel as I've to check out early, good variety of food. Train station about 5 min. walk. Overall a nice hotel for short stay.

住宿期間因冰箱開關意外被關閉,導致水果酒,草莓,牛奶腐壞,跟飯店反應卻只有一封道歉信,完全沒有正式拜訪賠償,最後連我寫給經理的抱怨信也沒有回應.除去這一個不愉快經驗,基本上這家旅館還算不錯.The house keeping accidentally turns off the switch of refrigerator, which leads to the corruption of two packet of strawberry, milk and fruit wine. However, the hotel just puts one letter on the desk in the room without any other make up. Even though I write back to the manager, I still get nothing after checking out for 4 days.

I traveled Japan for a month, and was constantly disappointed by the size and staff of the hotels I stayed in.However THIS hotel blew me away! Plenty of space, very clean, and an amazing staff!!It's just minutes from the airport which was great for us because we had to leave right after our stay.

Clean. Centrally located. Quiet. Not trying to appear as anything but a budget hotel. Make sure you use a personal email address you can access when you are in Japan ... as the German guests found out the hard way!

Room is clean and planned quite practical. Amenities are great.They have a shuttle bus to the airport from 4am (free of charge).Close from Ana mori inari Station (Keikyu). Nice izakaya, Okinawa cuisine, ramen...around. Also the hotel has a cafe (pasta ¥390)Ana mori inari is a local Shinto temple you can visit.

The hotel is excellent located if you are arriving at Haneda. The free shuttle bus takes you to the hotel in less than 5 minutes. The room is adequate though the bathroom a bit too small. The best is breakfast; the selection is ample and the quality of the products very good.

Typical Japanese business hotel. Small, clean and all the amenities you need for a quick stay close to Haneda airport. We had a late arrival after a long flight, so wanted to get to a hotel quickly. Less than 10 minutes by cab and only 1300 yen. Breakfast was a mix of Western and Asian buffet. Check in and out was efficient. I would stay again if I had a late arrival.

Our family stayed here on the last nights of our vacation, before our flight out of Haneda. I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the hotel facilities. The rooms are clean, modern and well equipped, and although I won’t say it’s spacious, it was large enough for two people. The staff was also very warm and helpful with our requests. The hotel also has a fitness centre on site, which is rather rare for a hotel in Japan. They had only basic equipment (treadmill, weights), but was enough to get refreshed. They also have a laundry facility, but we didn’t have the chance to use it this time.I used to live in Tokyo, but never had the chance to visit this district (except for the airport), and thus I took this occasion to wander around. There are several shops and restaurants around the nearest station (Anamori-inari), and there was a supermarket (Fuji) about 3 minutes on foot. You can purchase groceries there, and I even found one of my favourite bottles of Japanese whisky! They have shuttle services to the airport, but it turned out that it only runs in the morning (the shuttle service from the airport to the hotel runs from 6 PM until after midnight). Since our flight was later in the afternoon, we decided to take the train from Anamori-inari station to Haneda. Even though we had two pieces of luggage for each person (with wheels), the ride was easy enough. However, I would avoid rush hours …

two stations away to HND domestic and three stations to HND International ... shattle is available to HND in morning only not all day ... 5 min walk from Anamori Inari station ... good location to HND but nothing much around only recommended to early morning flights take

Great budget hotel. Room facilities are very good. Fridge, tv, tea making facilities, safe, air con. Room and bed small but adequate.Only bugbear was the pillows were like concrete. Note check in is at 3 pm and check out 11 am. Hotel has a reasonable snack bar and supermarkets are available in the road to the right of the hotel.Local railway station is a short walk away.Hotel is only a 10 minute drive to the airport.Would definitely recommend for a short stay.

Clean, convenient, free shuttle, amenities. Close to HND airport, not NRT! I really regret not staying here our first night in Japan. We stayed elsewhere to save money but taxi ate those savings and it wasn't nearly as nice. Lesson learned: stay before and after your long plane rides at a very nice hotel.

Having stayed in this type of hotel before, I had brought my own coffee but needed milk. Well the front desk clerk told me to get it from the convenience store, they could only give me sugar not milk. It is also a very noisy hotel, windows and doors are not sound proof. The bed was harder that other places but the room was clean and had normal bath. The breakfast was good although expensive, both Asian and American breakfast was available. Discovered a vending machine that sold coffee in the 3rd fl library room. The location is nothing special, there a few small restaurants, as well as convenience stores. Seeing the trains go buy is neat but that is about it.

We booked this hotel the night before our flight because it offers a free shuttle bus to/from Haneda airport (but only morning and evening). An added bonus was that our JR Passes didn't expire till the evening of our arrival so we freely used them on the nearby monorail and JR Yamamote Line to do more sightseeing. Very comfy bed and room big enough to lay out your suitcase. Convenience store very near.

We've stayed twice before at My Stays Haneda, it is a clean comfortable slightly unusual hotel, must have been an office building before, with pillars in unusual places in the room, but interesting because of this, It is extremely convenient for airport with free shuttle (not until late afternoon from airport to hotel) and a very relaxing restaurant and bar.This is why we have stayed here before as all the above, especially restaurant and bar make it an ideal place to relax and chill out overnight before an early flight and would have given 5 star reviews!We were therefore extremely disappointed to find on arrival that the restaurant and bar were closed all evening for a 'private' function (Room service was also unavailable!)We had no prior notice of this from either the hotel or Agoda, nor was there any explanation from reception staff, just a typed note sellotaped to the desk and restaurant door.I doubt very much if we'll stay here again.

Close to airport and free shuttle starting from 4 am (4-5am only to international terminal). Our double bed room was tiny and double bed barely fitted two people. Noise from the corridor, neighbors and outside significant. Didn't try their breakfast. Getting there from city is good, subway 10 min walk.

We (7 adults and 3 children) stayed a night in this hotel for transit purpose only.We arrived at Haneda Airport at about 11.00pm and our flight to Osaka is 10.00am next morning. As such, a simple place needed for overnight purpose and I think that Hotel Mystays Haneda just fit for us.Nothing much to talk about as we were there for about 7-8 hours only. A few comments as listed below:1. Free shuttle bus provided between the airport and hotel. It really makes your life easier. 2. Rooms are considered small (Japanese standard) but overall is clean, beds are comfortable and adequate washroom facilities.3. Convenience shop (Family Mart) just about 100m away.4. Free WIFI: not working at all.

Very convenient transit hotel. Good free-bus transport from the Haneda airport even at midnight, and next morning to Haneda. Reasonable price. Very nice bathroom. Good morning walk location; 10 min to Haneda & sea side and beautiful shrine. The only issue is very narrow room. Size is not a problem (20+ sq m) but so narrow. A bit bizarre to be honest. All in all, good to stay for overnight.

Great location for an overnight stay for flights to/from Haneda Airport. Hotel is modern, fresh, clean and well appointed for a small hotel. Staff are friendly and are happy to assist with any requests you might have including dinner recommendations. Onsite cafe is ok if you want a quick drink/bite to eat and the free shuttle bus is a plus (note you cannot pre book shuttle bus so first come first served basis).

I was glad they have a shuttle to pick us up from the airport, this saved time and money to find a bus or taxi.The check in was fast , my room is clean and cute ;-), wifi is good, everything you need for a short stay is there. The staff were nice and helpful. I recommend it for a quick stay.

This hotel is ideal when you have a morning flight from Tokyo Haneda Airport. The hotel provides also free transfer between hotel and airport in the morning. The room that we had was quite big compared to other properties in Japan.

Location wise its a good choice but overall not so great. The rooms are tiny & 2 people will surely struggle to fit in. I couldn't believe there are no bottled water in the entire property which is such a shame. Make sure to bring your own bottled water unless you want to wring water from the bathroom tap. This is a reason alone not to stay here. On top of that, you have to buy some kind of pay-per-view card to watch any channels on the TV. Finding the airport is a hassle on arrival. You have to go to domestic terminal and exit the airport building and then go to a parking lot with no signs to catch the bus. The $12 breakfast is a joke & full of Japanese/ Sushi. Who wants to have raw fish in breakfast? I am i will be not be returning.

This was my second time stay at this hotel. And there were some improvement from last year. This year I fpund some more complimentary. They provide face soap, face oil (make up remover), face lotion and body lotion. ( both male and female served by shiseido brand). Though these u have to take it yourself from the drawer at lobby area. + :1. Walking distance from subway, around 5mins .2. Fast check in3. Available free shuttle from n to airport. ( need to check the schedule from the lobby)4. A lot of restaurants and minimarts nearby.5. There's a small temple nearby called inari... Temple. Walking distance around 5mins walk. 6. Coin free washing machines and drying machines. 7. Free gym , libary and relaxing room.8. Clean rooms, towel and sleepwears. So far, I haven't find any unpleasants in this hotel yet.

stayed here for one night arriving from haneda and travelling out the next day from haneda. room was big, had 4 beds although there is only 3 of us. room is clean and overall very clean and convenient for an overnight stay. do take note their free bus shuttle to airport timing which is limited to mainly evening timing so we took a taxi from airport to hotel and costs us about jpy1200-1500 one way. can stay if you just need a simple room near the airport for transit purposes.

Really convenient for Haneda Airport with free shuttle but only at specific times to fit with check in/check out. Varied breakfast and English speaking staff. Major downside was I checked in late and given the last room, a smoking room, and it really did stink of cigarettes. Really disgusting and I couldn't wait to leave next day. The whole floor must be smoking as it hits you as you come out of the lift. Never book a 'run of hotel' room with Mystays.

Stayed at Mystays Haneda on the last night of our stay, before going home.As most things in Japan, everything worked excellent. Nice size rooms, well appointed. The hotel caters well to western guests. 3 minutes walk to local restaurant and bar street.The airport shuttle left the hotel on the minute, as expected.

I really liked this hotel. A quick summary below...Highlights- Very close to Haneda airport (1300 yen taxi fare each way)- hotel room was spotless- quite spacious- the breakfast buffet was decent- the other food at the Travel Cafe was quite good- good speed on the hotel wifi- not too far from the subway/monorail (about a 10 minute walk)Drawbacks- bathroom is small (not sure if this can be avoided in Tokyo though)- there was a male work at hotel restaurant, Travel Cafe, that was particularly rude to my mother and wife during our stay and it made them uncomfortable going back to the restaurantI would definitely stay here again.

This stylish hotel is an excellent value, which I booked after reading numerous reviews here. Staff were all very kind and friendly; the bright afternoon sunshine in my room was relaxing; and I found the library on third floor a really nice and inviting space with great travel books about Japan. The rooms are simple yet tastefully furnished with travel photos. And if you think about it, more airport hotels really ought to do this! Also the restaurant has nice Italian pasta dishes in addition to Japanese food. As a stopover between Okinawa and Hawaii I really found this hotel to be ideal for a tranquil day off from traveling. And I didn't hear a single airplane, it really was that quiet there!Finally: If you don't arrive when their shuttle is operating it's a fast an easy ride on the train from Haneda with a short walk. Or take a taxi!

A group of 7 plus a baby stayed here overnight. Rooms were comfortable although we had a choice of two, the pillows were very firm. We weren't able to get a cot for the Bub, which we knew but was rather challenging. Make shift cubby house. The shuttle was punctual and efficient both ways. Noodle House was convenient down the road with good food.

For a airport hotel in Tokyo it is very good quality. Very close for a late or early flight, cheap cheap for Tokyo. Great costumer service. Free airport shuttle and nice rooms. Restaurant is not the best but it is good for what it is

This property is very close to Haneda airport with late night and early morning free bus transfers, which was perfect for us as we arrived late and wanted to get back to the airport early to exchange are JR Pass. Accomodation was simple but adequate for the four of us, we didn't make use of the breakfast area but did get a fairly good nights sleep on firm beds and pillows. The only negative for our room was the lack of sound proofing which did wake me up, listening to people walk past on the tiled floors and there talking reverberating down the corridor.

Stayed here the night before my flight back to London. Good location with some good restaurants around. Hotel is very comfortable and good value. Free shuttle to Haneda airport which is a bonus.Recommended

This is one of the best budget hotels I've ever stayed at. The room was small but comfortable and serviceable, with all necessary amenities, including toiletries, tv, and a fridge, and some welcome extras like slippers, pajamas, and an electric kettle. Very, very clean and quiet. It is convenient to the train, so easy to get to the airport and also to downtown. I would gladly stay here again.

Stayed there 2 nights for our flight back to Malaysia. The hotel is strategically located to a Shrine, drugs store, convenience stores, restaurants, metro station and it is just 2 stops away from Haneda International Airport. Room was small but have all the necessities. We choose this hotel because it provides free shuttle starts from 4am but with first come first serve basis. The hotel by hotel shuttle is just 5mins away... very near.

I picked this hotel based on its proximity to Haneda airport, rail transit options, and the good reviews. The shuttle from the airport was professional and prompt though it was a little difficult to locate the pickup lot at the terminal for us foreigners. The information ladies in the international terminal told us they did not pick up passengers at that international terminal so we took the free shuttle to the domestic terminal to catch the hotel shuttle there. But when we left the hotel the shuttle bus dropped off passengers at the international terminal. Confusing.The hotel itself was clean and modern plus the desk staff were helpful and polite. The rooms were nice but small by western standards so be prepared. If you want western sized rooms in Tokyo be prepared to spend big bucks! The room itself was immaculate and stylish but the reason I didn't give the hotel 5 stars was the bathroom. It was functional but smelled musty, which wasn't too bad if you left the fan on. I think the problem is that there is an unsealed gap between the wall and the bathtub that can trap water and create mold/smells. Nothing a bead of silicone sealant can't fix.There are plenty of convenience stores and shops in the neighborhood to buy snacks and refreshments. A huge benefit is the train station about a ten minute walk away from which you can access the Tokyo rail system.Overall I was very pleased with this hotel and would stay again. If they can address the issue with the bathroom it would excellent!

My family of four arrived in Haneda Airport about 10 pm on Monday 21 Dec 2016. As it was too late to go to Hakone, our next destination, we stayed at this Hotel MyStay Haneda. We took a cab from Haneda International Terminal. Cost about 1100 Yen and took less than 10 mins to reach. Check in fast and quick. Room was ok for party of 4 (2 A 2C). Were given a room facing the road but the room was quiet, perhaps good sound proofing at wok here.The hotel's restaurant was closed so we went to a nearby convenient shop to buy dinner. Next day, breakfast was not too bad. We took a free shuttle bus from hotel to Haneda International Terminal to take our LimoBus to go to Hakone via Shinjuku Station. Didn't want to board the busy Tokyo train with the morning rush hour crowd with 2 luggage and 2 kids in tow. Overall we are happy with our stay in this hotel for 1 night.

Shuttle is provided for guest transiting the airport. The bus is stationed at the chartered bus parking area. The hotel rooms are bigger than usual hotels of the price range.Comfortable with multilingual staff

We stayed in their deluxe twin for the 2nd time in 2 years.Suggest to book early as there was only 5 such rooms available. Room was 29sq2 and spacious according to Japanese standards. The cost difference between deluxe twin and Holleywood twin (22sq) was 1000¥. Worth stayingog available.Made use of the gym which was open from 7am - 10pm. It was new.There was a refresh room at level 4 with 2 massage chairs and a self laundry room with 4 dryers and 4 washers which was available FOC. Detergent was available for 100yen.We made use of the free shuttle to the airport for our Disney trips and back to hotel as we prefer a more comfortable ride to the resort world.Last bus to airport was 1040 am. Will stay in this hotel again.

I stayed here for one night before flying out of Tokyo Haneda. Arrival by metro was easy. When arriving at the station if you ask at the ticket office they will give you a map of how to get to the hotel. But basically you walk out onto a t-junction, turn left, hit the main road up ahead (where the JAL hotel will be opposite you) and turn right, walk about 70 metres and the hotel is on your right. The room was quite large by Japanese standards, it was bright and clean. The bed was large and very comfortable, and the room was quiet. The room fee didn't include breakfast, which seems common when booking through tripadviser. I didn't have the breakfast so can't comment. The shuttle to the airport is quick and efficient, and they drop you at the entrance to international departures before going on to the domestic terminal. All in all, my stay here was exactly what I wanted. It was easy to get to, it was clean and comfortable, and my trip to the airport was made as fast and easy as possible. The staff were helpful and spoke English. I'd definitely recommend it if you have an early flight and just need somewhere to get some rest before travelling.

the subway station was a short 5 minute walk, front desk was very pleasant. check in and check out was a breeze. reserved a non smoking room and got exactly just that. free laundry was a GREAT perk (don't forget to bring 100 yen for laundry detergent and another 100 yen if you want fabric softner), tv monitor downstairs by the reception has updated flight information which was very convenient. shuttle was out in front to take us to the airport right on schedule. great hotel to stay if you have an early morning flight. the ride was only about 15 mins.
