New York City, New York

review_body: Stay here for 5 nights.The rooms are just adequate in size. For two persons need at least a Standard Queen which is 22 SqM.Rooms that face the main road, which is a 6-lane dual carriage way can be noisy with all sorts of vehicles including heavy transport vehicles as windows are not soundproof.The rooms are like Europe's Holiday Inn Express except that toilet is smaller. There was one night on the 12th Nov, when the toilet had some odour after we return to the hotel. However, after we turned on the toilet ventilator, the odour slowly dissipated.Someone wrote that the street leading to the hotel is quiet and deserted and it was unsafe. There are always people using main street leading to the hotel to the hotel and the street is lined with shops and food outlets. I guess the the person must have tried a shortcut to the hotel via one quiet street which is about 5 metres shorter or Google directed him to the shorter route. We tried the quiet street as well. Nothing to worry about. BTW the main street has very heavy human traffic during peak hours.Someone also mentioned that it is far from train station. I don't think so. The nearest train station Anamoi-Inari Train Station is about 300 metres away. A very pleasant walk.

This is a 'just ok' hotel along the lines of a travelodge or Howard Johnson. The room wasn't large but well designed for accommodating luggage. It is fairly basic and cheap looking in terms of furnishings - one of the thinnest carpets ever and the promo photos are flattering. My biggest grip. however, was the pillows which were small and very hard and prevented me from getting a good night's sleep. For this reason I would look to stay somewhere else if I was in this area again.In terms of location it is convenient; just a few mins walk from Anamori Inari station on the Keiku airport line, although there isn't a great choice of eateries in the area so we just had a simple meal at the hotel. Nevertheless, we were glad of the free airport shuttle whih runs every 20 mins from around 5am to 9.30am and is avalable on first come, first serves basis (15 seats) as it was pouring with rain when we left.Overall this is a so so hotel in a godd location for the airport but a little pricey for what it is is/

I stayed here 3 nights for conferences, the room was cleaned and tidy even the size are limited. The hotel situated very near to the airport but far from the train, There is no currency exchange service, due to the first night i came very late around midnight and very hungry, the room service close at 10.00 pm and i have US dollar with me, i contact reception counter to change the money but there is no money exchange service i'm a bit disappointed because normally the hotel will have currency exchange service (You should consider about this)Breakfast time close too fast at 09.30 am, but started very early. On the 2nd day i missed it because I came at 09.45 amShould have a bottle of water provide in the room even you can drinking water from the water tap.Anyway overall was very good.

We stayed at Hotel Mystays for one night October 7th on our way to the Art Fields. The location was fine as there was a free shuttle that took us directly there from the airport. We had a small standard room with nice amenities but we certainly felt it was overpriced for what you got. The breakfast buffet was okay. There wasn't any interesting restaurants nearby so ended up eating in our room. If there is a choice for an overnight stay, Narita is a much preferred little traditional town with interesting and excellent restaurants.

On first sight nice modern airport hotel.Great location near to train connections and airport.Quick check in.Room small but had everything needed. However when looked at closely dirty, especially under bed and fitted tv unit/desk.On site cafe basic and was closed for private function. However some great places to eat nearby. Especially 24 hour place on corner.We had to spend whole day at hotel before flight at midnight. Asked if we could have a late check out. Yes if we paid 2,000 yen per hour after 11am. So we left our luggage behind counter and explored locally.Used the massage chair room for a while which was good with tv and vending machines.There is also a library.This is a good overnight hotel and would have given a higher rating had it been cleaner.

Location is superb. Just 15min away from the airport. Shuttle bus is provided in particular time. Room is clean and have everything that we needed. Railway station is another 10min walking distance from the hotel.

The advantages to this hotel are that it is very close to the airport and they provide a free shuttle to Haneda in the mornings between 4 and 10am. It made for a seamless transfer for our early morning flight.However it seems that most restaurants nearby are distinctly average and there's nothing too exciting to see nearby. I imagine most people staying here would only be doing so for a night so it's fine for that reason but it's nothing special. The bathroom is compact but to be expected in Japan. The room had a weird damp/rot smell whenever we opened the window though. The air-conditioning unit didn't seem to work unfortunately. The layout of the room is really weird. Like a long corridor wirh the bed at the end facing a window. There's a big TV in the room but it doesn't face the bed. Not really sure of the logic behind that but luckily we had an iPad with us anyway. Wifi connection is good. We realised that if we'd booked the room on the night we would have saved £25 so that was a bit annoying. Can't comment on the food as the reviews of the restuarant put us off eating there. We were there literally for 12 hours and slept for about 4 hours before the flight. It was okay.

This hotel was convenient for an overnight stay. The rooms were on the smaller side but comfortable with nice amenities. Loved the bedding and pillows, and the pajamas that were provided were very cozy! The shuttle was nice to have but we had to wait at Haneda over 45 minutes to travel to hotel during the afternoon-would think it would run more often. Would stay here again. As a note, there weren't many English speaking staff members at the desk so keep that in mind.

This hotel is good for an airport stopover but it's not somewhere I enjoy staying. The gym is only open 0700-2200 which is very inconvenient for an airport hotel. The reception staff are rather rude and check in was incredibly laborious.

It is only 2 stops or so from Haneda International and I would return and stay there again. It is only a 10 minute ride to Kamata (Keikyu) and near to Hamamatsucho giving you access to anywhere in the city. The hotel is clean (white), new with great rooms (spacious enough) and a modern twist. Close to the train station with plentiful convenience stores and with a free Haneda shuttle in the morning, be on time, served first comes first goes. Recommended.

I spent one night at MyStays Haneda as I was arriving super late and didn't want to pay for the cab ride to my capsule style hotel in central Tokyo that I planned to stay at.I got a GREAT deal on this hotel through Expedia and was able to confirm my reservation through the MyStays website a week prior to arriving through their live-chat function which was incredibly handy. The hotel has a free shuttle from Haneda which operates late into the evening, and seeing as I was getting in after 11pm, this was a great way to save some money to get to where I needed to stay. There is a timetable and information on where to get the shuttle directly on their website which is a major plus. The hotel is pretty basic, but seems to be new/renovated. The lobby has a low ceiling but is bright and features a nice looking cafe/restaurant attached to it.Check-In was quick and efficient, although the clerk serving me was pretty stoic. Not unfriendly, but just...stoic. I tried to request a late checkout but he informed me that every hour over the checkout time of 11am would be an additional 2,000 yen (as is fairly standard for hotels in Japan as I have discovered; it's rare to get complimentary late checkouts). No apology that there was a charge, or remorse, just very matter of fact stoicism devoid of personality. Not the end of the world but it would have been nice to see a bit more of a smiley and friendly personality. I booked their lowest category/smallest room as I was really only staying here for a grand total of 12 hours. The room was definitely more narrow than your standard hotel room, but was a lot "longer." There was a water closet/shower room right after walking in, followed by the double bed nestled nicely in the corner closest to the door. Beyond that was a sitting area that faces the desk and TV's. The room actually felt perfectly spacious and comfortable for one person despite it being their smallest room. It would also be perfectly adequate for two people, particularly if staying just for a night. The shower and water closet was very clean, and the water pressure and amenities were perfectly good. The bed was comfortable and I got a really solid nights sleep. AirCon in the room, and cleanliness were top notch at this hotel. My only regret was not staying here a bit longer. The location isn't great if you're trying to explore Tokyo, its a pretty significant trek to get into the city but there is a subway station just around the corner from the hotel so the ride in to the city is manageable and for the price point it is considerably less than city center hotels of equal or comparable value I found. One of the best things about this hotel though is that you book rooms directly as either smoking or non-smoking: there's no requesting a smoking/non-smoking room as they segregate this in the reservations process, and, appeared to separate the floors accordingly too. If you're allergic to cigarette smoke like me, you'll love this hotel. I would definitely stay here again, even if it was for longer than a night.

For the price offered, this hotel really give value for money. A perfect hotel for those who arrive late evening and need a place to rest. Room is spacious for japan standard. Amenities is good and staff were helpful. The airport shuttle is on time and there is a convenience store and restaurant that open till late night nearby. Also a short walk to anamoriinari station (keikyu line)

I stayed in mystays haneda because my flight was in the morning. This hotel near station and not too far from haneda airport. I really surprise, the room is quite big for hotel in japan. The staffs are kind, room is clean. And they have free shuttle bus to airport. Recommended place if you want to go to haneda

This hotel is very convenient when travelling to/from Haneda airport. It's also easy to travel to central Tokyo. We were fortunate that our flight arrived in the late evening so were able to take advantage of the free shuttle. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The downsides were that the room was rather noisy because of the refrigerator and it smelled a bit damp (it was a ground floor room). Breakfast was good value with a number of options.

Was here for one night before heading to Saitama. Was looking for options inside Tokyo but all did not seem to worth the value (especially we arrive late and were only there for one evening). This hotel is 15 minutes by train from Haneda - a easy 5 minutes walk from the station. Staff speaks good English, room modern and clean. Although the area is a commercial/ residential area, you will have no problem finding convenience stores and late night eateries at all ranges. You can also order room service until 2300. Will definitely stay here again next time.

Hotel was good value compared to Tokyo hotels. Arrived on late flight and caught hotel shuttle to hotel for over night stay. Shuttle was smallish so some people had to wait for next shuttle. Shuttle times could be a lot better. Only operates early morning and late evening for international terminal. Handy though for just an overnight stay. Stayed here one night before moving on to Yokohama. Room was good size for Tokyo but had a large pillar which took up room. Free wifi in room was appreciated. Paid for buffet breakfast which would not recommend. Very limited choices!

We stayed here for one night after arriving late at Haneda before heading into Tokyo the next day. Shuttle bus was relatively easy to find and ran right on time, we booked a standard queen room, which was a good size although much of the extra space was taken up by a column, but as we were only there to sleep this wasn't much of an issue. The room was clean, and the bed was reasonably comfortable. Not much more to say really. IOt was cheap and convenient for the airport with a good shuttle bus service.

Hotel is close to airport and provide shuttle service on first come first served basis.First shuttle is at 5.20 for international and 5.40 for domestic. There are 15 chairs in the lobby which supports the first come first served process as the bus is limited to 15 people. If you miss it, wait another 20-30min.The walk from the metro to the hotel was through an unsafe street, never had I felt more in danger/unsafe than anywhere else.The room, booked the standard room for 120usd so expect something at least, but got twin bed, with no airco, stains everywhere and a dirty shower. We just slept for 5h and left asap. Never again in this hotel. Don't understand the good reviews from other guests.

review_body: And very good to who used midnight airplaneGo and come between airport is well connected by free shuttleAnd clean guest room and well facilitiesBut price is low ( I used by under 8000 )I like to come again if I go Japan again :DAnd I think here is well to traveling about GSF- but I forgot it :(

Nice stay here for one night.Less than 10 mins from haneda airport by train and the hotel has a free bus service to the airport only for morning flights.Rooms very clean and bathroom clean too.Quiet play to stay a nive little town for strolling around.Would definitely return here.pleasant and helpful staff at reception

Good value hotel, convenient for an over stop before an early flight next morning. We arrived after 9pm and were so pleased to find the hotel had a restaurant that was still serving food. Our double room was very small but functional, OK for a one night stay and everything was clean and new. Free shuttle bus to the airport in the morning, worked on a first come first served basis, make sure you get there early as the bus filled up quickly, we had to wait for the next bus 20 mins later, not a problem if you allow plenty of time.

Near to Haneda with free airport shuttle service. We stayed for one night. The room a bit small, clean and comfortable. This hotel is near to JR train station, easy access to city. There's a relaxing room with massage chair and microwave.

We did a book-end here on our trip to Japan. We stayed there the first night and the last two nights since we wanted to be close to the airport upon landing and before we departed. The room was great, small as is usual in Japan, and it was located close to the airport. Our bathroom tub had some drainage issues that were problematic but we dealt with them. There is an airport shuttle to Haneda but beware as it is first come first serve. We also located a train station nearby and took it in to Tokyo at the end of the stay and over near Mt. Fuji for a day trip.Figuring out the trains was easier than we thought and the station nearby had good connections. I would stay there again.

If you are just staying for one night because of convenience - then it is an okay place but don't expect much.We found the room to be really small and not comfortable at all. I did not have a great sleep.One plus though is that they have self-serve laundry which we found to be super helpful. It was quite cheap too (the laundry that is).

The hotel is in a great location, 5 minute walk from the train station (the line runs from central Tokyo to the airport and beyond) and about 15 minute walk from the Haneda airport tram stop (can use JR pass for this one - which again runs from Tokyo to the airport).The hotel offers a free shuttle bus to Haneda airport which leaves every 20 minutes. It took us about 7 minutes to reach the international terminal. Make sure you arrive at reception at least 10 minutes before the shuttle departs as the bus was completely full when we went on it (which meant it left about 5 minutes early as the bus was full by then!)The room itself is good. Very spacious and wifi was particularly impressive (it says 1 device per room but we didn't have an issue using 3). The bed was comfy and has useful features like light switches close to the bed. The bathroom was also fine.Overall it was perfect for somewhere to sleep before an early morning Haneda flight, but to be honest given its proximity to the train station it could be used as a base when exploring Tokyo for a few nights.

Arrived here and was a very easy walk from the subway station. Very impressed by the room - good size, good tv, good wifi, mini fridge and the beds were very comfy. The bathroom was also very modern - shower was one of the best I've used in a while. Shuttle to airport in the morning was very easy and literally took minutes to get to the international terminal. Booked last minute so didn't get a great deal so not exactly great value for money but still a great stay here

Windsor and Maidenhead, United Kingdom

review_body: It's a nice place , not far from the rail station to Haneda airport and it offers a free shuttle bus to Haneda airport for early departures, which is very convenient. The rooms are very comfortable and there is a very reasonable priced room service. There's also a relaxing room with a microwave oven to warm your bento and free ice cubes.

We got into Haneda late at night and booked a hotel at Haneda Mystays rather than trying to find a place in central Tokyo. When I booked they sent me and e-mail offering a free shuttle service to the hotel from the airport which was punctual and a nice touch. Checking into the room was fine and the service was great. The room itself had a semi double bed, a nice bathroom and all the amenities you could ask for - including matching pyjamas! Overall this hotel was exactly what we needed - a rest before our exploration of Tokyo. The only downside was the expensive breakfast offered in their cafe.

We stayed here for one night before our flight back to the UK. The staff were welcoming and the room quite spacious and clean comfortable. We took the monorail from central Tokyo to get to the hotel which left us with a 10 minute walk down a busy road but there are other transport options too. The shuttle bus to the airport was fine in the morning too. We had breakfast at the hotel which was pretty good. Mostly traditional Japanese food and with a few more western options thrown in too. The evening menu wasn't very inspiring through so we walked 5 minutes up the street to find somewhere else.

We stayed one night before an early flight from Haneda. The hotel is ok located for this purpose. Not very good location for a longer stay in Tokyo. Free shuttles in the morning and evening. NB! First come, first serve. Not possible to book in advance. Taxi to airport international terminal is just 1100 Yen. Friendly and efficient staff. We arrived early so our rooms were not ready. The staff kept our luggage and moved it to our room when they were ready.Comfortable beds. Nice outside terrace from the restaurant. No great view, but nice for a drink and snack in fresh air. I could use this hotel again, but would prefer the hotel at the terminal if available.

This hotel was a convenient choice after nearly 20 hours of flying. The room was sufficient and amenities were basic. The washing machine and dryer for guest use was a nice surprise. There is not much to see in the area except the Shinto shrine behind the hotel. This hotel would be a good choice for those that are in transit, as it is very close to Haneda Airport.

We choose this hotel because its near to airport. Its perfect because there is shuttle to airport, but there is schedule, so better check with hotel if your flight fit with the schedule. Room is not very big but enough to open one luggage and put other luggage In the corner. Its clean also the bathroom is clean. Its near to station anamori, and many convenient store nearby

Really unimpressed with this hotel, from my experience I wouldn't recommend the Mystays Haneda. I don't have any photo evidence, so take from this what you will. I personally had a bad experience but that may not represent other customers views.When we arrived we were earlier than the check in time (3pm) which was fine so we explored the area a bit. After checking in we went to our room it wasn't very clean at all; there were dead flies stuck to the ceiling of the bathroom and there were some white kinda crusty stains on the over sheet thing on top of the bed. There was also a couple of spiders in the room, which can't be helped but they were very difficult to catch as they jumped (perhaps something to be wary of in this area). Also the room was not very sound proof, so we could hear what was going on in the corridors outside, so I didn't get much sleep as people were constantly coming and going. However the room was very comfortable and was well equipped as well as being spacious.We checked out the next morning and took the shuttle bus. The checking out process was quick and easy and the shuttle bus was very handy, especially at 4am.However we got to the airport and our flight was delayed by 24 hours, British Airlines were completely unhelpful and just told us to sort ourselves out, so we reluctantly booked another night there.We arrived back at the hotel at 8am, as we knew that the check in time was at 3 pm, we just waited at the lobby as we were tired and didn't want to walk around. At around 11am staff began checking in guests, however when I asked to check in early they told us we had to wait, so I was annoyed but I understood that there may have been special circumstances. But the staff continued to check in other people and when I asked again to check in early and they told me that I had to pay 2,000JPY per hour that I checked in early. I speak Japanese and had been listening to the other people checking in and they had not mentioned it to any other guests, I was really annoyed and feel as though we are being treated unfairly.SUMMARYFood 4/5 The cafe is quite expensive but the food is niceStaff 2/5 Staff are not particularly helpful, although they do speak English, Japanese and ChineseFacilities 5/5 Rooms are well equipped and there is also a laundry areaCleanliness 1/5 Room was not up to standard and is one of the main reasons I rated the hotel very low, because it's a very basic thingOverall I had a poor experience and will never be returning to this hotel or any of the other Hotel MyStays

Hotel is literally 3 min walk away from the train station. Rooms are nice, clean and modern. The check in staff were very friendly and welcoming. Hotel provides free self service laundry which was excellent and there is a relaxation room on the second floor with massage chairs etc for relaxing which is a nice touch. Hotel doe snot provide any black tea which I was disappointed in and in our bedroom there was no milk or sugar provided for coffee which was a bit strange. The hotel provide a shuttle bus to the airport which is really convenient and the journey time is around 5 minutes. The hotel manage the bus really well with a queuing system in reception to ensure it really is 'first come, first serve'. I would definitely stay here again as it is good value compared to hotels which are in the airport itself.

Clean rooms, new, well equipped and courteous staff. Highly recommended for short stays as it's so near Haneda and shuttle bus very convenient. Good value for money also. Gives good impression on the Mystays group.
