Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I stayed for a day at the hotel because my flight started at midnight. the hotel is very clean and nicely furnished. The staff is very friendly. Unfortunately, the Airport shuttle service is only in the morning available.this is very disappointing. Train station is 5 minutes away. I would book the hotel again if continuous shuttle service is offered.

Check in and check out process fastRoom is clean, spacious considering we are in TokyoHave complete amenitiesThere is supermarket nearby.The hotel provide pick up and drop off service which is very good considering no nearby subway station.The pick up is for 6pm onward arrival.The drop off is for morning flight.Pls ask hotel for exact schedule.

I stayed here for one night before catching my plane in the early next morning (8:50 AM). I arrived at the Haneda airport at 7:00PM from Vancouver.Short reviewPros:- Great shuttle service early in the morning (but be sure to arrive 10 min early)- Close distance from Haneda international airport (only about 2 stations using Keikyu line)- Kind staff who speaks English well- Proximity to the subway station and conviny- Quiet room and hotel- Clean room- Morning call serviceCons:- Bathroom is small (just like any typical Japanese business hotels)- Zero view- Area is too quiet; nothing to do around unless you go to the KamataI planned to visit Tokyo for one night before taking another plane early in the morning the day after. I have to say that I found nothing bad during my stay at this hotel. Good thing about this hotel is that the subway station is close by so that even at night, it was easy to get to the hotel. I spent my night time at the Kamata station eating the top Tonkatsu (pork cutlet) then do some Pachinko and end with some onsen at a nearby sento (public bath).In the early morning, I received a morning call which was really nice and was able to get on the shuttle without a problem.I can't speak Japanese at all yet I had 0 troubles.I was deciding hard between this hotel and the JAL hotel and Toyoko INN. JAL hotel is right next to hotel mystays. I think I am happy with my choice. I will definitely re-visit if I have to make a transfer from Haneda.

I booked this because I landed at Haneda late at night and wasn't sure about trekking to central Tokyo at a late hour. This was the biggest room of my trip, with ample space for you to open your luggage. The room was well furnished, with speakers and an international TV channel (I think CNN), which was a first. Decor is sleek, modern and clean. The hotel is located next to a huge office building (with the Takyubin symbol) so there's a fair number of convenience stores around. The only improvement is that they could start the shuttle from the International Terminal earlier. I had exited the customs check by 10pm and had to wait 45 minutes for the shuttle. The shuttle starts earlier for the domestic terminals but you had to take another shuttle bus to those.

We stayed a night at MyStays Haneda as we intended to take an early flight the next morning from Haneda to Asahikawa. It helped there is a free shuttle between Haneda to MyStays. Arriving late in the evening and departing early the next morning means that meals have to be quick. Fortunately MyStays is just a short away from a convenience store where we purchased our quick hot meal for dinner and enough stuff for the breakfast the next morning. It does matter that the first station of our 11-day Japan adventure starts on the right note. Mystays fulfilled that. Within the short few hours in the hotel, we just felt that it has addressed our needs wel. The room in Mystays is very decent and comfortable. It does not intend to splurge on excesses. If there are items that the room does not provide, we may collect them from the open cabinets in the lobby e.g. laundry bags.The staff at the front desk were warm and were able to assist us in our departure the next morning. It was a very pleasant stay.

Great staff, clean and nice rooms. Shuttle to airport was fast and on time. Rooms are fairly small but appointed well. The wifi is setup in the room such that only one device can be connected at a time.

Late arrival to Haneda airport and happy that we booked a night for short stay.Hotel is close to airport (just about 5-10mins) and free shuttle is provide between airport and hotel with friendly driver who also helping to take care our luggage. The room is clean, cozy and with all basic needs (they even provide DHC skincare at ground floor by self service). The bed also quite comfortable to let us have a good rest after the flight. Everything just very good enough for short stay in a reasonable price!Highly recommend to anyone who need a stay for late arrival or catching early flight.And I definitely will book again too!!The last shuttle at 00:25, I will give a 5 stars if the shuttle service can be extended :)

Was looking to stay close to the airport for a cheap price and descent accomodation. And I found it. Caught the train and then walked to the hotel which was only 5 min from the station. The hotel had a nice lobby and the staff were very helpful in getting the shuttle to airport in the morning,The room was large bed was nice and the bathroom was good. Internet was helpful as i had work to do. was a short stay i highly recommend if you are doing the same.

We have stayed before at this hotel and choose it again due to the comfortable rooms,cleanliness and lovely big bath.Staff were helpful and friendly.Room was a good size for a Japanese Business HotelBreakfast(buffet) was plentiful with a good choice ( Better to pay on arrival, rather than in the morning as you get a discount )It is only a few minutes walk from the nearest metro and there are many convenience stores in the vicinity.Free laundry was very useful.Free shuttle to Haneda in the morning was a bonus

Location is convenient; 3 min from the train station. We arrived at night and caught the hotel shuttle to the airport. Unfortunately, the shuttle does not run 24 hours and had to take the train back to Haneda Airport, which was not an issue. Room was reasonably priced, clean, comfortable and well designed. A few restaurants and convenient stores nearby.

We stayed twice in this hotel; once after we reached Japan and another when we were about to leave Japan. We reached Haneda Airport late at night but was able to catch the free shuttle. We stayed a night to sleep (room with 4 single beds) and relax so that we can travel with our 2 young children to another city the next day. Husband was amazed with the room as he was expecting the room to be smaller (because he travels often to Japan for his business trips). The hotel is also near (walking distance) to a train station (Anamorinari).After a few days we checked out, we checked in into this hotel again (room with 1 queen bed) to rest and relax before heading to airport for our late night flight home. We only checked in for about 8 hours. Lucky there are rooms available as I booked this room last minute (the night before) through their official website because we could not figure out earlier whether to spend 8 hours loitering around with kids in the airport or the kids (and us too) can get some proper sleep before going to the airport.The staff are friendly, always smile and speak fluent English. The staff also helped to get us a taxi from the hotel to the airport at night. Will definitely stay here again if we visit Japan in future.

Hotel room is small but the design is really cool. Room has a sink, refrigerator and rice cooker, Free wifi, Clean rooms and bathrooms. Very near train station. Restaurant also available at the lobby,Shuttle bus to airport is available,

The room is clean but a little small. When we opened both of our luggage there's barely any walking room. It's a perfect stay for those who have an early flight to catch or for those who arrive late at Haneda Airport. There are two convenient stores within walking distance so it's easy to grab food and drinks during odd hours. The nearest subway station is a distance away though, but not terribly far and it is easy to navigate.

Nice hotel, 5-minute ride from Haneda airport. They offer free airport transfer. There are nearby convenience stores like Family Mart and Lawson. There are also good restaurants which are walking distance from the hotel.

We needed a hotel close to the Haneda Airport. The hotel offers a shuttle bus to and from the airport (a 10 to 15 minutes drive), which was the decision making factor.Decent, comfortable room. Breakfast was at the time not a highlight.

We stayed with Mystays Haneda for 1 night (the first night we flew in around 2am) Pros: 1) Easy to find (taxi driver instantly knew where we wanted to go) 2) Super close to the airport3) Ample DHC samples and amenities for guests to use4) Clean, modern, and sleek looking rooms 5) Close to a couple of convenient stores 6) Had a simple but cheap selection of room service food Cons:1) They are renovating the hotel so my boyfriend were awakened by the crack of dawn by a couple of men duck taping the carpet outside of our room. Having slept at 3am...this was a bit annoying.

We are arriving late at night around 22:30 and by the time we finished immigration ( long queue ) it was already 23:30. We are glad we booked this hotel and their free shuttle bus (blue color) is at the Group Bus area. It took only 10 minutes to reach the hotel. The checkin was quick and we are rather hungry and we are happy to know there is a Lawson 24 hours convenience shop nearby. It has lots of drinks and fast food available.The hotel staff is very helpful and kind to give us a Toyko metro map and direct us to gets to our next destination the next day. The metro station is also very convenient around 10 minutes walk.Its a nice and simple hotel.

This is the first time we go to Toyko. As we arrived around 11pm it will be too rush to take the metro to city hotel and we are not familiar with the complex metro lines. We are glad we book this hotel because they provide free shuttle bus service which took us to the hotel. The room is consider big compare to those city hotel. The staff is very helpful to give us a map and help us gets to our next destination the next day.This is a simple, clean and nice hotel.

A very recommended hotel when arrived late in Haneda Airport. Free shuttle bus is provided up to 00:20. The hotel design is very sleek and minimalist. Cleanliness is off the chart. Complete amenities, include pajamas.

My 2nd stay in 6 months with a day s layover in Tokyo to visit the 3 must do sights re Tsukiji, Asakusa and Yanaka !Free shuttle every 1/2 half hour with a helpful bus driver to help you load up. No tips if you are used to the $1 you give to shuttle drivers as you ll insulting them if you do. Arigato gozai Mas is sufficient appreciation The bath room may be too small if you are a big guy. That aside it s neat with a seat warmer n bidet. Not much of a view but I just need a place to crash for a nite. 2 ways to go downtown to Tokyo station either the local suburban train with 2 changeovers and lugging your suitcases up or down some stairs or shuttle back to catch the monorail to one station before Tokyo Station.Get a metro card Suica and park your luggage in a rail locker 400 to 600 yen and you can get around for the rest of day before you catch your next flight home.

I chose it for its location and the shuttle service to the airport - to be honest it is perfect - there are plenty of restaurants nearby, its easy to get to by train and they have a shuttle to the airport for when you need to leave.The rooms are a little compact but fine for a night.Already booked for my next trip.

We stayed in standard semi-double room, its a narrow room and the bed is big enough for slim - medium size people for 1 or 2 nights. If you are a bigger person or staying longer, it might be better to get a standard double room.The room and hotel seemed new and clean. The staff were pleasant and efficient at check-in. There is a lounge room which I'm guessing are on every floor of the hotel, it has a large TV and 2 x massage chairs and a vending machine. The control on the massage chairs is in Japanese so careful what setting you select, I could only find the setting that gave my back a pounding!Free shuttle bus takes you to the airport in around 7 mins and there is also a station 3 min walk away from hotel for when you arrive.Our room was on one of the higher floors at the front of the hotel. When we opened the window a smell of exhaust fumes entered the room, there was no traffic outside, it was actually very quiet due to it being a Sunday night, not sure where the fumes came from, closing the window solved that problem. Would still stay here again despite this.

When your luggage doesn't arrive with you, this is a good place to stay! Toothbrushes, pjs, slippers, coffee, tea etc. all provided in our family room for 2 adults and 2 kids. In fact I'm not sure I have ever stayed in a hotel with so many extras (even a shoe horn??) Beds were firm but comfortable with a range of pillows offered (though none of them were great). Plenty of space for a family. Reverse cycle air con within the room. If your plane leaves or arrives at the right time of day, then the shuttle bus is also very efficient. Only a very short drive to the international terminal. We noticed a Family Mart very close by and a restaurant within the hotel (neither of which we used). A bit pricey for us, but well worth it for the conveniences offered when arriving in Japan late at night with no luggage!

The Airport shuttle service was the deal maker; so I was a bit upset when they didn't have schedule for morning arrivals. Other than that, everything went well.The hotel looks new and clean; despite the language barrier I feel the staff were genuinely trying to accommodate; room wasn't spacious but not too cramped; BATHTUB!!! yayy!!; and they provided pajamas set, which is a very nice touch.Train station and eateries are within walking distance.

Great place to stay if travelling out from Haneda early in the morning. The room is great - modern, comfortable and spacious for japanese standards. Fast food restaurants and convenient stores are literally steps away. Free shuttle van to Haneda every 20 minutes on a first come first serve basis. We have no issues getting on the van at the time we wanted.

The hotel is very clean, the rooms are bigger than look on the internet, we stayed 2 nights first night arriving and last night leaving, If I had known the hotel was that great we would of stayed there for our whole trip, Monorail and train station 10 mins walk away .All staff are very friendly, we arrived 2hrs early and was aloud to check in early, was great after a long train trip from Kyoto Free Laundry, great relaxation room, with FREE massage chairs just what you need after a full day of site seeing. I will be using this chain of hotels on my next visit. highly recommend the hotel.

We stayed as two adult and one child of eleven. A very spacious comfortable room with three small double beds, complimentary pyjamas and slippers! Spotlessly clean, free shuttle bus with a prompt, helpful courteous driver. Check in was efficient and our bags were taken to our room while we were out. Check in a little earlier than 3pm would be helpful for guests. I think 3pm is quite late.We arrived at the hotel via Ana Mori station which is on a private rail line. Leave the station and turn left and walk down the lane, when you reach the end of the lane the turn right the hotel is about fifty metres on the right.

A clean hotel with a free shuttle to the airport. That sums up Mystays Haneda. As the hotel doesn’t have room service we went around the neighbourhood. Plenty of small restaurants around. We went to a Chinese restaurant on a small lane after the railway crossing. The food was very authentic and a welcome change from all the Japanese food we had been eating. Ask the front desk for the neighbourhood map.There was a shop selling Japanese goodies next to the train station. You can buy all your Japanese snacks and sake to bring back home from that shop.

We stayed here as we had an early flight out of Haneda. Literally just slept in the bed and surprisingly the room was a lot bigger than expected and the bed very comfy. The great benefit of staying here is they have a free shuttle bus to Haneda airport which is great for early flights. We caught the bus at 5am which is before the metro starts so otherwise we would have had to pay for an expensive taxi ride.
user_name:
Kimand2boys
Burton upon Trent, United Kingdom

review_body: The hotel is a very short walk from Anamori Inari railway station, quite doable while lugging wheeled suitcases. The room was well designed, certainly not large but adequate for one night, and well equipped. It was great to have a kettle and a decent sized fridge. The staff were helpful and clearly comfortable with dealing with foreign guests. I didn't try the breakfast as it seemed expensive at 1200 yen if booked in advance when there was a cafe practically next door offering breakfast for 200 yen and convenience stores a stone's throw away.Had we been able to get the wifi working in our room (we didn't, though it worked fine in the lobby) we'd have given this hotel five blobs.

Excellent location close to airport and reasonably priced for an overnight stay prior to early flight Free shuttle bus *15 seats on first come first served basis to terminal (arrive ten mins before your desired departure time to get a seat)please note - additional charge for breakfast

We only stayed one night, arriving from Kyoto and leaving early the next morning for a flight. We booked a room for 3 people which was more spacious than we were expecting (in fact the biggest of the 3 hotels rooms we had in Japan). It had 3 good sized beds which were very comfortable. Neat bathroom, very clean. Took the complimentary shuttle bus to the airport the next morning. The hotel staff helpfully printed off our boarding passes. We were aware of the humming noises from the aircon and the minibar, so we turned them off and slept peacefully! The corridor flooring was partly tiled and our cases made quite a noise when we wheeled them out at 6am, however we were not bothered by it if others were doing the same during the night. There was a large and airy room for breakfast and drinks. Would recommend as a stopover.

We were pleasantly surprised by how quiet the room was. A comfortable room close to the airport, offering free shuttle service and free wifi.the staff was very helpful and spoke very goo English (not to be taken for granted!)

This hotel is close to the airport although at times, because of traffic, it may take up to 15-20 minutes to reach it by car. The room is small and has little space for big luggages. Bedding is fine. Breakfast is unremarkable. There is a shuttle service from the airport but it is a bit erratic: when we arrived there was none available and had to take a taxi (about JPY 2,000). When we left we missed it by a few minutes and rather than waiting 20 minutes for the next one we got a taxi again. They have food room service but only up to 2 pm (weird). Front desk staff are ok but the one we dealt with seemed to have a substandard knowledge of how to get around the area. Overall it is a decent place for an overnight, but nothing special.

The hotel is close to the airport with free shuttle from Haneda airport to the hotel.The room is small but well equipped. The environment is good and quiet, good to act as as stop over after a ride on flight or ready to go to the airport.

Have stayed here many times. Very convenient to Haneda Airport. The also provide a shuttle but it does not operate for late night flights. They also have laundry machines (free). Located close also to Animoiri train station, just a short walk. Will take you to Shinagawa station in about 10 minutes.

As we know Tokyo and were only staying a short while there before moving to other parts of the country, we opted to stay further out expecting this to be better value. The room was too small, there was no wardrobe - just pegs on the wall and the airport shuttle only ran early in the mornings and evenings. We arrived at around 10:30am to find that we would have had to wait until 6pm for the next shuttle!! We wanted to spend as much time as we could in Tokyo so we left our luggage in left luggage and collected it later in the day which was cheaper than taking taxis to and from Haneda airport to the hotel.The laundry in the hotel is great and the washing machine took some working out due to it all being in Japanese.Personally, if I went to Tokyo again which I probably would do, I wouldn't stay here due to the shuttle buses being extremely limited.

This hotel offered shuttle service which was great when your flight arrives late at night. The room was comfortable. There was a small inviting library, a cafe, and the hotel was close to a convenience store and the subway.

I stayed in this hotel for 1 night while on business in Tokyo. I arrived on a very early flight and my room was not ready until 3. The girl in reception was very friendly and helpful. She spent 15 minutes showing me where to go and things to see in the city. On my return I had some problems:1. The wifi in my room was not working and it took 4 visits to reception before I was moved to another room. After being moved the wifi was perfect.2. As I was travelling early the following morning I asked for an iron and board to get my clothes ready the evening before. The boy in reception said he didn't have any as they were all given out. No offer of giving me one at a later stage.3. I also asked could a taxi be organised for me for the following morning and again the answer was no. The boy told me he couldn't organise for me and told me use the free shuttle bus to the airport. The following morning when I got up, the breakfast was good with plenty of choices and the lady in the restaurant was very nice.I also asked the girl in reception where I could buy some wasabi so early in the morning and she was so helpful and I was able to make my purchase.This hotel is nice, clean and modern. It's a pity that the one unhelpful member of staff stopped me giving a higher rating.

Two days before we arrived, my partner went to the website and a customer service greeted him via the website built-in messaging system, then further asked if there are anything that they can help us with. This is something that we have never experienced before. We stayed just for a night before continuing our trip to Tokyo. Room was designed smartly - there was a sitting area and a desk in our room despite its limited space. They provided pyjamas and slippers for use during the stay.

Room is not as big as what I thought but overall is still a reasonable size of room you can get in Japan. Clean and well presented. All the staff are so friendly and polite. Had a peaceful sleep well night after a long hours flight.

The hotel room is big and has a lot of facilities especially massage chair which I very enjoy it. The hotel to convenient store and train station within walking distance. Mystays hotel provide free shuttle bus to hotel from airport.

Comfortable beds, two pillow options, larger bathroom than I expected. The hotel is about a 5 minute walk to the Tokyo Monorail (we waited 5 minutes for a local train on Sunday morning, and were in the city within 22 minutes).

We stayed here for one night for the convenience of access to Haneda airport with the airport shuttle. We travelled here from the Ginza area, which took about 28 minutes and it was only a 5 minute walk from the Anamoriinari train station on the Keiyku-Kuko line. That set us up nicely for the early morning flight. The hotel was great value for money - room was small, only 9ft wide, but functional. The provision of slippers and pyjamas was a nice touch as was the clothes brush and shoe horn hanging by mirror opposite the wardrobe area. A good range of amenities was provided. The double bed against the wall wasn't so convenient for couples. The front desk team were efficient and spoke good English. We were advised to wait in the lobby about 10 mins before the departure time for the airport shuttle. That worked very well the next morning. The driver was so wonderful in helping us put the luggage on the bus. The bus left right on time. He was also so gracious as to lift the luggage out of the bus and place on the pavement for us. Amazing service. Thank you.

We stayed here for 5 nights in a double bed room, the bed was a sufficient size for the both of us. Room was cleaned everyday with a new set of Japanese style pyjamas laid out on the bed. Toilet in room was very clean, shower was good pressure. Hotel was quiet, food served in restaurant was only ok (only tried dinner). Staff at counter were pleasant. Everything in working order, small gym, small library room. Vending machines on each floor. Not difficult to get into the city on the train, nearest train station barely 5 mins walk from the hotel. A couple of convenience stores around for snacks. Would stay here again, very enjoyable.

5-10mins shuttle bus ride from the airport. If you're arriving from the international terminal, you have to walk towards the GROUP BUS stop and NOT route bus after you clear customs. This is explained on the hotel website as well. The shuttle bus is BLUE in color and has the hotel name written on it. There will be a lot of other buses at this area ie for cabin crew, other hotels in vicinity so just wait for the times listed until you see a blue bus. Rooms are clean and it serves for a comfy night's rest before onward flight.

This is quite a new airport hotel, think it has only been opened for less than a year. We had a 6am flight at Haneda airport so decided to stay nearby. They have a mini bus shuttle which takes you to and from Haneda. It is first come first serve so give a little buffer to make sure you can get on as it does get packed! It is literally 7mins door to door so no need to worry even though it is not directly located at the airport. Check in and out was fast and staff was nice. The room is a bit bigger than normal Hotel size in Japan. There is a family mart walking distance which is very convenient. We would stay here again if we need to stay closer to the airport!

Stayed with my husband here overnight after a late flight in to Haneda airport. They hotel had a free shuttle from the airport (we had to wait maybe 10 mins?). The room was a reasonable size for Japan and we were able to easily lay our suitcase on the floor and open them. The hotel has free WiFi but only one device can be used at time. There is a train station around 5 mins walk from the hotel although it is not a major station so getting to central Tokyo requires changing stations. Good for an overnight stay.

We stayed here for 1 night because we had to catch an early morning flight. The rooms are huge by Japanese standards. The hotel shuttle to the airport is free and very convenient (less than 10 minutes drive). We had lunch at the restaurant in the hotel and it was very good. But the buffet breakfast was very average. There is a convenience store close by, quite a few eateries around and even the metro station is at a 5 mins walk.

My family of 4 stayed in this hotel in Dec. We were on our way to Sapporo. The hotel shuttle is very convenient. There is a train station which is just 5 mins walk from the hotel. Near the hotel is a cafe that sells beef rice. Oiishi. Staff is helpful and can speak English.

Great hotel for a stopover near the Haneda airport. The hotel offered us a shuttle straight from the airport so it was very easy late at night on our first visit to Japan. The hotel itself was very clean, modern and comfortable, but be aware that the rooms are going to be tiny compared to western standards. For us it was perfect though as we don't need much space. We were going to Kyoto the next day, so we could catch the metro from the hotel right to the bullet train station. The breakfast buffet is a bit expensive and there are little shops nearby that you can get a sandwich, but if it's your first stop in Japan when the buffet might be worth it as it's easy and has lots of delicious options. Overall, we were very happy with the Mystays Haneda and the great value.

This is a great hotel to stay in if you arrive late or need to leave early from Haneda airport. There is a complimentary shuttle bus from the airport to the hotel which operates at least till midnight. The staff were very helpful spoke perfect English and even helped by printing maps and train timetables for our journey the following day. The room was plenty big enough for two people with a standard size double bed, which was extremely comfortable and had more than enough room for two. There was tea and coffee and toiletries in the room and wonderful pyjamas and slippers. Everything was beautifully clean, and modern.Right outside is a familymart shop that is open 24/7 so you can get food etc even if you arrive late.I was very impressed with this budget chain hotel and they made our first nights stay in Tokyo very comfortable.

stayed 2 nights on different rooms. Hotel provided shuttle from HND late at night up until 24:20. That's good when your flight arrived after 11pm and you are not sure you can catch the last train. Room is modern and clean. The size is good compare to other chain hotels in Tokyo. Hotel has a free laundry (only 100 yen for laundry detergent and 100 yen for softener). Massage chairs are on fourth floor. The neighborhood has several cheap eateries around. You will get an authentic Japanese neighborhood feel just down the street. Also, if you are into Japanese health care products, there is a cheap pharmacy within a block from the hotel which sells discounted health care products.Easy access into Tokyo subway - about 25 minutes to Shinagawa and 50 minutes to Shinjuku.

Hotel MyStays Haneda is a good option for those who need the convenience of staying near Haneda Airport. I stayed here twice on a recent trip. The first time I landed late at HND and wanted to catch the first morning limousine bus to NRT. The second time I arrived at NRT, took a limousine bus to HND and then shuttled to-and-from the hotel to catch a morning flight from HND. The complimentary shuttle is easy to find from the HND terminals (there are good maps and schedules on the hotel's website). The rooms are simple, small by Western standards which I think means normal by Tokyo standards :) . The hotel feels new and the rooms are clean. Despite being next to Haneda I did not hear airplane noise from the room and slept soundly. I didn't try the hotel breakfast but it did not seem too popular. By no means is this a hotel for staying at multiple days, but if you need a convenient hotel near HND after a late arrival or before an early departure, Hotel MyStays Haneda is a good option and certainly cheaper than the on-site airport hotel!

Room was small, but had everything we needed. Immaculately clean and everything in it's place (and a place for everything!). The front desk were extremely helpful and welcoming. They also help us ship our luggage to next destination via 'Black Cat' service. The hotel is near the airport so it's a train ride into the more touristy areas of Tokyo - but when staying at a hotel near an airport for the convenience of the airport, that's expected. Local train station only 5 mins walk away and easy enough to get around. Get a Passmo card and you can load with cash and don't have to buy separate tickets all the time. My only downside of the hotel is that the airport shuttle only runs at really limited times a day (to airport in the morning and back from the airport evening). This isn't made obvious when booking - you have to dig around to find out. But you can get from Haneda to hotel by train. We learned all this the hard way lugging skis and duffel bags. Aargh! If all this had been a bit clearer - or if the hotel ran an all day shuttle - they would have got 5/5 rather than 4/5. Bottom line: you stay here for the closeness to airport not to replicate Lost In Translation :)

We stayed here at the end of our trip before we flew home. Our room was very cheap and excellent value for money. It was small but very clean even managed a fridge, hairdryer, cosmetics etc which is normally lacking in budget places. We caught the shuttle to the airport in the morning which was on time and luckily had space. Even if the shuttle is full the train station is literally a 2 minute walk away and also goes to the airport.

The room I have was a twin room with kitchenette. Room and everything inside was super clean. I love their toiletries!! They have a free laundry room so you can clean and dry up your clothes if necessary. Also have gym,library,refresh room ( have free massage sofa ),and meeting room. Restaurants close by was a lot and train station were walking distance. Staff are helpful too. My son was playing safety lock and twice locked my stuffs inside and they were quite patience to help us unlock it.

Clean hotel near the airport, albeit with tiny room. Staff had limited English (seems like only one staff at a time speaks good English). Would have given them a four star but for the fact the shuttle from the airport never came and we had to wait about half an hour for the next shuttle

We found this hotel through trip advisor and reviews were accurate: clean, near airport, near subway, very small! Best thing was a mobile hotspot rented from the hotel lobby. We were able to use phones away from the hotel - great!
user_name:
Donna T
Hot Springs Village, Arkansas

review_body: We stayed here for a night after reaching Haneda airport late at night. Free limousine bus to hotel is very much appreciated, though it took us some time to locate the place to board this bus. Reception service is pleasant, rooms are slightly above my expectation in size, and well designed.

This hotel is very close to handed a airport. It's a good stay if u arrived late or have to take early flight. They offer free shuttle to the airport, check out their schedule on their website.Room was small but it's Japan, as long as it's clean we felt OK. The level of cleanliness is good. Breakfast wasn't included in our package however there is a convenient shop and a sukiya restaurant which operate 24 hours, so getting foods were not a problem.

This hotel is very clean and looks nice inside. They have a free airport shuttle bus that is first come, first served. You cannot make a shuttle reservation, just come to the lobby and tell them you would like a shuttle to the airport and then you can get in line. The bus was empty so not really any issue getting a seat. Not far from Anamori Inari station on the Haneda express line...just walk about a block and you're there.

Stayed here so that I can have a good night's rest before catching an early flight the next morning. This hotel exceeded expectations easily - Room was much bigger than expected. Bed was super comfy. Not sure how long this hotel has been opened, but it definitely felt very new. I think there were only 2 food places round the corner which were still opened when I checked in at 6pm. In fact, there are more convenience stores close by where you can also grab quick meals and snacks.  Shuttle commences at 4am and runs every 30 mins. The ride to the airport is slightly less than 10 mins. Note that it takes 15 passengers each trip - first come first served.Warning: Getting to this place is a little tricky on the Keikyu line. It takes a while to figure out the train that will stop at the Anamori-inari station.

The rooms were larger than other hotels we have stayed at for a higher price sonwe were surprised. Quick wifi, friendly staff and shuttle access to Haneda Airport only a 5min walk away. Only a few mins walk from the Kamata station.

Hotel is approximately 2 stops away from Haneda Airport and offers a shuttle service. I had fairly low expectations for the night but the rooms were surprisingly good. Rooms are very modern and more specious than normal Japanese business hotels. Only downside was the check-in wait time - there was a shuttle bus load of customers who arrived when we arrived for check-in so that took a long time unfortunately, but otherwise a good stay in general. Suitable if you have an early flight from Haneda the day after.

Stayed here for one night while in transit to another Asian destination. The hotel was convenient for us as they had the free airport shuttle that ran all hours. The hotel itself is nothing special. Rooms are decent. They did the trick for a quick airport layover.Breakfast was marginal at best. You should purchase breakfast at checking (it's cheaper).Gym was horrible, mostly only cardio machines no weights.

As my flight arrived late at Haneda airport and I need to get to lake kawaguchi early the next morning, I decided to stay a night here. Great that the hotel provides shuttle bus to and fro the airport. However, thought the bus is quite small. Better be early to queue in case you are unable to catch on the bus timing. You can't reserve seats. Do check the hotel website for bus time table.The deluxe room is spacious enough for two persons. It's clean and the bed is comfortable.The staff is friendly and helpful nd they are able to converse in English.

We were surprised how good this hotel is. Just a short walk from train station, this hotel is really clean. It looks new and modern.It was supposed to be our overnight stay before our flight in the next morning. If we knew that it's this good we could have stayed here the whole time we're in Tokyo.Really reasonably priced.The staff is friendly and efficient. Room is clean and well equipped. View from room is pleasant.Free laundry facilities, massage chairs...are few pluses.Only if the air-conditioner be quieter at night, the hotel will get 5 stars from me

Hotel Mystays Haneda is located a short drive from Haneda Airport in Tokyo. The hotel looks relatively new, and by Japanese standards, the rooms are incredibly spacious. I stayed in a deluxe double which had a double bed, sitting area, desk, small kitchen with microwave, luggage storage area, traditional style Japanese bathroom (seated shower with separate bath) and separate toilet. The wifi at the hotel is great and only requires you to login once. There are a few small restaurants and convenience stores a short walk from the hotel. The hotel provides a free shuttle bus which picks up guests from all 3 terminals, and also drops them back to the airport approximately 3 times an hour. I look forward to staying here again if I have another layover in Tokyo.

Except for the 1st C if that don t bother tallor huge persons, this hotel is ideal for an overnite layover. The nearer to the city, the higher the room tariffs. Here you have to pay approx US$85 for room for 2 .The room is functional and don t expect any view of you r on ground floor. I like the water closet and the bidet, both of which is heated as with easy to use controlpanel.I did not try the breakfast as I m not a breakfast person but if you find the price a tad expensive, venture out.If you need a fix on local culture, given the lack of time, you might want to go to next block to explore the fox shrine and temple where you will find a big red arch（tori), many mini toris, drinking well, and many food stalls selling rice cakes, sweets and cute handicraftsThe hotel provide a free shuttle to and fro airport but finding the location of the pick up is a challenge as signages are not clear for 1st timers to Japan nor is information desk officer able to direct you to bus terminal located on lower ground. Best you find a business suited local whom is likely to direct you in simple English. Expect a crowd of guests for registration at reception esp. if there is a full load in the shuttle. Do expect a copy of your passport to be photocopied

With a late plane arrival, we were looking for an hotel close to the airport and that was a very match. The rooms are confortable, quite small but big enough for one night. Breakfast was fine with some continental choices. It was then convenient to catch the subway from the hotel.

We landed in Tokyo Haneda Airport around 10.30 pm and since we bring d kids, we have to get a room to clean up and rest before going to Disneyland in d morning. I found about this hotel here in tripadvisor. Thanks! They hv free shuttle bus from airport to their hotel. Its super easy to find d bus!And also they will provide you with the shuttle bus timetable so that you wont miss d bus! Its really accurate here in Japan! The hotel was small but it was good enough for us to rest and cleanup. The place was really clean and well maintained. Just one thing...all d electrical stuffs were in Japanese!! so each time u were stuck with d appliances pls get help from d receptionist. Next morning was good too, we board the free shuttle bus back to domestic airport terminal 2 to get d bus to Disneyland.

A good value hotel if you need a place close to Haneda for the night. Rooms are very small, but clean. Breakfast has a wide variety, and the free buses are frequent to and from the airport. Not recommended for families due to room size.

Very good hotel if you leave from / arrive at Haneda airport early morning or late night. Hotel is very close to subway station (couple of minutes to walk) and offers transfers (every 30 minutes) on a first come first served basis to the airport. Room was spacious with everything you need. There's some restaurants and a convenience store around the corner but not very much else. As a base to explore Tokyo it's too far away from everything. For spending a night right before or after a flight it's perfect. Would definitely stay again.

I'm glad I booked Mystays Haneda having arrived at the airport around midnight and was able to hop on the hotel shuttle bus by 12.11am. Arrived at the hotel within minutes and checked in quickly. The hotel is a no-frills sort of place. Don't expect vast amenities, but it serves it purpose. Offers free wifi, slippers, pajamas, foam pillow (which I requested in advanced and they placed it in the room prior to my arrival). For overnight stays, I would highly recommend Mystays Haneda, but probably not beyond that. It's 40 minutes from the city and my room faces the back staircase, so don't expect a view. When I checked out of the hotel it was pouring rain. The receptionist could not offer me an umbrella as I was leaving the hotel, but she did offer me a towel, which I was very grateful for.

This was our last hotel during our trip to Japan. It was close to the airport and had an airport shuttle which is why we chose it over our usual stay at a Toyoko Inn. It turns out that it was quite a nice hotel to our surprise. Think along the lines of a Holiday Inn Express, but a little nicer. The hotel was a few blocks away from the train station. The lobby was simple but elegant. The adjacent dining area was of a nice contemporary decor. The breakfast was a combination of Japanese and Western style food, both buffet style. Cost was separate, but I think they have it included with other packages.Check-in was quite easy and most of the staff spoke English or at the very least understood it. We got simple rooms with full size beds. I don't know if I was just tired or what, but it was the best nights sleep of the entire trip. The entire room and bathroom were impeccable.The room had a clean comfy bed. Room also came with a small desk, fridge, small closet, and small functional bathroom. It also had the Japanese style tub and toilet seat.For the price and short notice, this hotel was a great value. Would highly recommend.

The airport and the train station are reachable in few minutes. To be taken into consideration if the arrival or the departed are during night or early morning. There's a free shuttlebus from-to the airport.

Booked a grand deluxe room. Had 4 beds. Room is spacious. Alight at anamori-inari. 2 stops away from Haneda. Only 1 exit, walk straight towards hotel JAL, end of road turn right,200m ahead is MystaysHaneda. A lot of eateries nearby but all open at night. There is a decent cafe sells breakfast. Nice stay! front desk staffs were very friendly but the male staff duty on sat night didn't get what I was saying and stare blank.

Based on the relative inexpensive price of this hotel, I was not expecting much. I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel in every way. The free hotel shuttle from Haneda airport is great for 1st time visitors to Tokyo. The front desk staff was VERY helpful in making travel and sightseeing suggestions. The guest room was small by western standards, but it was absolutely perfect for someone who was interested in doing some minor work from the desk, sleeping, and leaving. The room can be described as a very efficient use of the space, with all new and convenient amenities. When was the last time you stayed in a room that comes with not just a refrigerator, microwave, and electric tea kettle, but also a rice cooker and a vegetable/dumpling steamer??? The hotel has a relaxation room with free massage recliner chairs, a free library, a free workout facility, and an onsite restaurant. It is also only one block away from the commuter train line. When comparing the price of this hotel to others in the area, considering the amenities, convenience, and friendly staff, I have nothing but positive comments to say about this experience.

The trouble with some flights is that they arrive late at night when transportation becomes more challenging. MyStays Haneda is close to the airport and accessible by hotel bus. The check in process was smooth, and you get to opt for breakfast for a fee if you choose. I did this time and the breakfast was decent with several choices. Its not the best but its a good welcome to Tokyo. The rooms are usual business size....haha i.e. smallish but adequate. It is equipped with air purifier and a hard bed. The space was decent especially if you are just overnighting. The surroundings is quite at night, but walk a little, towards the convenience stores, you would soon discover food outlets, a sukiyaki and ramen shop. Adequate as a welcome. The check out is smooth and the bus will bring you back to Haneda the next day for your journeys.

Great hotel, with full amenities and clean room. room not large, enough for 2 person. location is good, around 10 minutes from haneda airport, there also minimart nearby. professional staff,but less smile. don't try the breakfast so can not comment for the breakfast

We found the staff to be courteous and professional. The hotel has a small library, and a relaxation room with a vending machine as well as an Ice machine for your drinks. There Is also a laundry room on the ground floor and for 100 Yen each you can buy a small box of detergent and a fabric softener sheet. Our return flight was for 12.30am and we were allowed to leave our bags with the reception whilst we ventured out for our final day. This was really helpful to us. The room we had was very satisfactory, with a toilet that was separate from the bathroom. The main space was modern and well laid out, with a good amount of space and amenities. There was room behind the entrance for luggage and a desk as well as a small seating area.* It would have been helpful to have the air con Instructions In English! I eventually somewhat figured It out.The area Is surprisingly close to Haneda airport. There Is a limited free hotel shuttle bus to and from the airport at certain times which we used upon arrival. However It does not run later In the evenings from the hotel so we took a taxi. Travel In Tokyo Is not cheap but the fare was not too much with the airport being close by. The train station Anamori-Inari Is nearby and trains go to the airport which Is another option available. There are a couple of 24hr mini markets very close by such as Familymart. However, If you want better prices and much more choice a couple of blocks behind Is a Fuji supermarket. The area Is quiet and residential but there are a few nearby places to eat out.Make sure to visit the small but charming shrine, Its a short distance behind the hotel. All things considered we were satisfied with our stay at Hotel Mystays Haneda.If you are In Tokyo for a few days and plan on spending much time central then you may want to consider a hotel closer In.

This one was a little let down for me. I was expecting more having stayed at other 3 star properties in Japan. Also, in my opinion this doesn't qualify for a 4.5 star Tripadvisor rating. I wasn't too happy with the attention to detail about this property. The amenities used inside the washroom and the room are mediocre at best, I have had better ones at other 3 start properties in Japan. Pillow was memory foam, and they couldn't provide feather pillows as none were available. Perhaps hotel was sold out. Wasted time on setting wireless internet as the password sheet had an error with password. Buffet breakfast was mediocre..Spread was small but okay for a one time breakfast meal and 1200 yen. Not worth at 1800 yen.I went to a small supermarket FIJI closeby this is very nice as well as a 7-11.For those trying to use hotel shuttle from airport to hotel, keep in mind of the operating hours. As my flight was an international flight, during the day, the hotel shuttle didn't make a stop at the international terminal. Only domestic terminals. So i ended up taking a taxi 1200 yen.

This hotel, located within ten minutes of Haneda Airport, is a grand place to hit after the long flight from the States. Everything was neat and clean. Staff quite friendly and helpful. Best of all, when compared to Tokyo rates for rooms, this property is quite reasonable. Shuttle from airport to hotel runs every 20 minutes. Be prepared for a long trek from your gate, through immigration and customs, to the hotel shuttle pickup location. I think there was Wi-Fi, but was too tired to try for it. Only one night, leaving early the next morning.

This is a very new hotel with attached restaurant. It is either a 3 minute walk from Aamori inari train station on the Keikyu Line, (not free fro JR pass holders). Turn left when you get out of the station, walk until you come to a main road, turn right and it's about 200 metres on your right. If you cross some train tracks you're going the wrong way when you come out of the station. Or it's an eight minute walk from the Tokyo Monorail station Tenkubashi (free for JR pass holders and connect onto the free JR line at the terminus of the monorail station, which is Hamamatsucho)When we walked into our room we were pleased, it was 23 square metres, that is pretty large, esp, for Japan.The room was clean, the beds comfortable, the amenities you get from the drawer in Reception, the bathroom large enough for two to use at the same time. What we liked best was the gym, the library and the relaxation room which had these really cool massage chairs facing the TV which you could use with the wired headphones. There were also sofas/ couches in this room and a drinks machine and ice machine.The restaurant food was only average and did not have breakfast so cannot comment. Reception staff were friendly and efficient. Highly recommended. The wifi did not like Apple devices, only androids.

My wife and I stayed one night at the Hotel Mystays Haneda. We arrived too late at night for the free shuttle, but it was no problem taking a taxi to the hotel. The drive was less than 10 minutes (I did not actually record the time, but that is what my wife and I recall). The room had pajamas, slippers, free wifi. The room is small, but adequate for a transit hotel. Breakfast was a bit disappointing in that the eggs and some other dishes in heated pans were cold. However, overall this is a good hotel for an overnight stay near the Haneda airport.

Me and my husband stayed here for 3 nights, we had a restful stay. The staff has been very helpful to us. They had lend us umbrella because our entire stay was running cats and dogs. the breakfast was okay. The hotel was close to family mart, small supermarket, karada, and 711. The Anomari station is near also. There was:1. Pajama2. Toiletries3. SlippersAnd Laundry with dryer!!! :) Massage chairs and microwave. so convenient. :)The hotel is a bit far from the city but we will definitely come back to Hotel MyStay Haneda. Thank you for making us feel at home. :)

I arrived with my family at Haneda Airport at 2 am, with the plane delayed for 2.5 hours. I already made a reservation one week before. I informed the hotel regarding our late check-in via the website chat session, which was very handy.We arrived at the hotel at 330 am due to lack of taxis so late at night. Our fare costed about 1300 yen. The shuttle bus was of course not available by then.Our room was nice and cosy, probably small by Western standards but comfortable. I appreciated them giving us pajamas for the night; it is a nice touch for weary travelers who may be too tired to open their luggage to get their sleepwear for the night.We did not have breakfast there, but there is a Family Mart nearby. We then took the shuttle to get back to the airport terminal: it was every 20 minutes which was very convenient.I will definitely stay here again if I happen to have a late flight to Haneda Airport. I hope the hotel will keep the chatbox open in their website: it sure saves a lot of money rather than calling them up in case of a late check-in etc.

Convenient to the Haneda Airport with free shuttle (best to pick up from the domestic terminal - If arriving at international terminal, look for sign directing you to the domestic terminal). It is located in an industrial/residential area and hence few amenities in close proximity. Restaurants close early although there are two convenient shops, one block in either direction. Be forewarned that the Travel Cafe next to the hotel is expensive with limited menu items and poor quality. For me the best item on the menu is beer. The hotel room is spacious for Japanese standards, modern and very clean. The room contains a double bed, air purifier, kettle, with good WIFI (instructions are in the room to connect, password, etc.) The staff are very courteous and helpful.

The hotel was fresh and clean, staff helpful. Shuttle bus to airport in the morning was great even though you cant pre book we had no problems. The bed was amazingly big for a Japanese hotel. Only a short walk from train station which worked well with transferring from Narita.

I book this hotel through reading review from Tripadvisor, and it didn't fail me. The airport shuttle was on time. The room is clean, the staff are very friendly and helpful. This hotel is also very close to Anamori inari station which take us to Omiya, Saitama, our next destination. The free wifi provided is fast.

Great airport hotel! Clean, welcoming staff, great location, free airport transfers, FamilyMart supermarket a few doors away, restaurants close by (as well as reasonable restaurant in hotel) and exercise room with modern equipment. Recommended!

Hotel Mystays Haneda is a pleasant stay. The rooms are quite small (welcome to Japan) but it is clean, well run and professional. The staff are helpful and the housekeeping staff are honest and thorough. Just be aware if you have purchased a JRpass Hotel MyStays is on a private line which will cost you additional money on top of your JR Pass.

Affordable stay which is also convenient from the Airport. Arriving Haneda via Air Asia at about 10 something, one can either take a bus or train to the city (assuming there is no delay) or one can hop on a hotel bus and spend the night in Haneda.Mystays Haneda is one of those trendy hotels that offers those travellers who do. We arrived at Haneda at about 10 something and made our way to the Bus corner to wait for the transport. The Blue Mystays shuttle arrived within 10 minutes and we were on our way to the hotel.Checking in was a breeze and the convenient store just 2 minutes from the hotel was really good for purchasing a midnight snack. Hotel room was nice, comfortable but narrow (normal for Japan). But it is still good for a night's rest. Breakfast was not included for our stay (need to add additional 1200 yen) so we decided the convenient store outside would be a better bet.The Hotel is about 5-7 min walk from Anamorrinari Station. Going to Tokyo, you will need to make sure you are on the farther side of the platform. As the first platform will be towards Haneda.Overall, I think this hotel is a great place for an overnighter as it is comfortable and good location to mediate between the city and Haneda Airport

Clean, comfortable, new and friendly service near Haneda airport. Larger rooms than a typical Japanese business hotel. Good value for the price and an overall good experience. I will stay here again when I need to be close to Haneda airport.

I wanted to make my early trip to the airport easier and decided to stay here. The free shuttle was very convenient. The room I had was, by far, the biggest of all the rooms I'd stayed over my two weeks in Japan. It wasn't the cleanest though. The desk area was covered in dust which was very obvious...It seemed to me housekeeping had run out of time to get the room ready as other parts of the room were very clean (i.e. bathroom, bed area, etc...). It also has a chill-out room with massage chairs and a library. These two rooms were very comfortable and a great place to relax before/after your long flight. I had dinner in the hotel which I found very average (actually, quite greasy). Breakfast wasn't a lot better, though, quite a lot to choose from.

Had a early flight to catch, so decided to stay here. Very near to metro and also free shuttle to the airport.The are was quiet and afforded a good nights sleep.Rooms was clean and comfortable, although the positioning of the desk would cause problems if you were overweight.Breakfast was good and plentiful, but ran out quickly and items not replenished.Will definitely stay here again on our next trip to Tokyo

When you exit from Anamori Inari station (there is only one exit) look to the left and you will see the Hotel Jal City in the distance. Head towards it, and when you get to the main road turn right and walk about 50 meters and your there.I paid just under $45US/night booking 3 months in advance on Hotels.com. The hotel is pretty new and very comfortable. It is an excellent place to stay for one night, very close to the airport. The shuttle to the airport is very convenient and only takes about 10 minutes.They only have WiFi and no LAN.There is a Fuji supermarket not far away, with many prepared foods to take back to the hotel and eat. Ask reception for a neighborhood map.The Hotel's breakfast is 1800 yen which I did not bother with.

It's a new hotel near Haneda airport. I stayed here as my flight came in late at night. There is a free shuttle bus from and to the airport.The hotel is very close to Anamori Inari station and Family Mart.The room is clean, spacious, and very well equipped.

We booked this hotel because we arrived at haneda at night. Because our flight delay we missed last free shuttle but the taxi only cost around JPY 1.400. There are Sukiya 24hr near hotel, the food is good for our late dinner. The hotel is good and clean, quite big compared with other hotel in Tokyo.

My family was on transit to Hokkaido and had a 12 hour lay over. I booked this hotel and was happy with the shuttle service & hotel facility. The rooms are small, as it's with most hotels in Tokyo but it was comfortable enough for a family of 4(with 2 kids). There are convenient stores just around the corner. I'd highly recommend this hotel if you're transiting.

Was on a transit and came across this hotel. Reasonable rate as only needed a bed for the night. Grabbed the free shuttle bus service from the airport to the hotel. Staff were first rate and checked me in fast. Room was a double, good size for Japanese standards and super clean throughout. Thoroughly recommend this hotel for stopovers at Haneda airport.

Arrived at Haneda Airport at 12.20 am, out of customs etc by 12.40 am and caught a cab (as the free shuttle finishes at 12.30 am) costing about 1,400 Yen to Haneda Mystays; was in my room at 1.15 am. Staff were very friendly and had no issues re speaking english.On checking in you are directed to the amenities cabinet in the foyer. Inside the cabinet there are lots of bathroom/hygiene products to choose from, everything from shaving razors and moisturizers to shower caps.Room is small but very functional, new and clean. Pajamas are provided in each room as are house slippers.Local train station is about two blocks away providing handy access to Tokyo central.Tip - if you intend to have breakfast at the hotel buy the prepaid voucher as opposed to turning up on spec as there is a big saving by doing so.

Quiet spacious room in new hotel. Room was at the front of the hotel overlooking a busy road. No disturbance from traffic noise.The room was very clean with all amenities at hand. Friendly staff. Dinner and breakfast were good. Plenty of choice on the menu. Breakfast was either European or Japanese food. Free WiFi was available in the lobby and restaurant. The free shuttle to Haneda airport was punctual as is the "norm" for Japan. Would stay again.

I missed out on the evening shuttle bus, so took a taxi from Haneda which hit 2000 yen before we even left the airport grounds! Be careful you don't get scammed. This was the only time I had a dodgy experience in Japan.The hotel itself offers a free shuttle in the morning. There is a cafe on the ground floor and quickymarts nearby. It is a typical Japanese hotel: small, clean and comfortable.

Great and inexpensive hotel, very close to Haneda airport with a very handy shuttle service (early morning and late afternoon - night). If you arrive during the day, there is the option of taking the train or taxi. The rooms are clean and very modern. They offer extensive bathroom amenities. My only reservation is the breakfast which costs 1,200yen. I was told that the breakfast was until 10am, I turned up at 9.30 and it was already too late!

The 5 minute taxi ride from Haneda International Airport to the hotel costs under 1000yen. The hotel is very new and welcoming upon check-in. Rooms are very clean and in decent size, unlike typical hotel rooms in Japan. There is a convenience store 1 minute walk from the hotel with plenty of hot / cold food options. Highly recommended for tourists who arrive Haneda at late evening, just park there at a reasonable price (comparing to hotel rates in Tokyo) and recharge yourself before going into Tokyo, the train station for Shinagawa is only 8 minute walk away.

Usually, you do not expect much from airport hotels. But this is an exception. Welcoming staff at a bright reception, cosy and quiet room with all you need including slippers, nightwear. You get an option to pick extra amenities from reception like face cream, comb, cleaning milk etc.Breakfast was extra 1200 yens but was worth of it - there was even a mini baking owen to warm pastry. Sure, japanese dishes were available as well.
