review_body: Brand new, comfortable and complete with toiletries. I would have stayed here longer if I were on business trip or were not required to move frequently around town and tourism spots.Transportation to/from airport provided with puncture schedule.

We decided to stay overnight at Mystays Haneda since our flight arrived so late and cab fares to the city are exorbitant after midnight. For the price we paid for a night, we got much more than we bargained for! I expected just the bare basics but instead the hotel offered luxuries such as speakers you can plug your phone, tablet, laptop or other electronic device into and a full set of pajamas! There is also free WiFi and a free shuttle to and from Haneda Airport, which was easy to find and very convenient. Overall impressions of this hotel is: FANTASTIC. The whole place looks very new; it's clean, tidy and well kept; the staff were quick and efficient checking us in; and the prices for such magnificent rooms with luxurious facilities were more than worth what we paid! Will be staying here again if and when we ever decide to come back to Tokyo.

We really enjoyed our time at this hotel. The staff were very polite and helpful to us. The room was very clean and and well equipped. The hotel is very close to the airport and there is access to the Keikyu train line and the Tokyo monorail nearby. We liked the Travel cafe in the lobby as well. The food was excellent and the staff were great to us. I would recommend this hotel to anyone needing a place to stay in the Haneda-Ota area.
user_name:
Jeff K
Canonsburg, Pennsylvania, United States

review_body: This is an excellent value hotel close to Tokyo's Haneda airport. It is also convenient for transport into the city.i confess that I was expecting a very basic hotel given the price, but it was a very pleasant surprise. My room was facing the main road but the sound insulation was excellent. Traditional Japanese slippers and pyjamas were provided and the toiletries in the ensuite were good quality, with extra items available free in Reception. The room itself was a reasonable size for Japan and was really well finished and equipped. Facilities included free wi-fi, a really practical desk and sofa, a fridge, tea/coffee making and plenty of power points and a good size comfortable bed.The staff were really friendly and even provided me a map of local convenience stores so I could pick up some food as I had arrived late.Breakfast in the morning was reasonable value and there was a good selection of Japanese and Western choices. It is great that it opens at 0500 so those people catching early flights still have time to eat.The only negative is the frequency of the hotel shuttle in the evening. I arrived at Haneda at 2200 and had to wait nearly 45 minutes for the minibus because it runs to a timetable rather than on demand. In the morning there was no such issue as the bus operated every 10-20 minutes.

Excellent for overnight stay prior to early flight from Haneda. Hotel looks very new or recently refurbished. Room a good size and bathroom excellent. Cost £85 for night and breakfast extra at about £6, mainly Japanese food. But, finding the shuttle bus at the domestic terminal is quite difficult. I had to get one of the "Information" people to take me to it. Not with the other bus stops, but across the zebra crossing and in a car park beyond. Driver was helpful. At the International terminal the bus stops across the road again outside departures. Shuttle service from the hotel to airport is easy and works well. Every 20 mins.

I took this hotel on our late night arrival as well as the night before our early departure to and from Haneda airport. There is free shuttle bus between Haneda airport and this hotel, which took only 7 minutes to the International Terminal. Note though the bus does not run 24x7, check out the schdule of the bus in the hotel website, it is very comprehensive and easy to understand. There are only toothbrushes in the room, for other amenities such as lotion, cleansers, etc. you should grab them upon check-in from a chest of drawers near the check-in counter. Breakfast was adequate, not glamour, mostly Japanese choices. Rooms are very clean and new. Wifi is available in room, just follow the instruction given in English, a few minutes of entering information as instructed and you should be connected to wifi. The hotel is good for overnight stay to and from airport for early or late night flights. Note that the train lines around the area of hotel are operated mostly by Keikyu, therefore your JR Pass is invalid. There are very little shops and eateries around the hotel either.

Its just 5 mins away from Haneda international terminal, hotel provides free shuttle bus service. The room itself is very clean and spacious (compare to those in Tokyo downtown) We got a seamless room everytime we return, kudos to the housekeeping. Locationwise, it's just 5 mins walk from train station, and a 40ish mins train ride to Tokyo downtown (Shijuku/Shibuya). There are a few convenience stores nearby, a ramen and a beef bowl store which opens until late at night. All in all, it's a nice place to stay!!!

Clean but small rooms. But it was quite ok for one night. Hotel seems new. Staff was friendly.We stayed for one night as our flight came late at night and they had an airport shuttle.Breakfast was good. There was a mix om western style breakfast and Japanese breakfast.

We had a one night stay before a red eye flight from Haneda. Chose the hotel based on the distance from the airport and the provided shuttle.Too bad that the free shuttle does not run all day in both directions to all terminals. Look up the schedule on the hotel’s website to avoid surprises.Otherwise the hotel is a short stroll from the Anamori-Inari station.The hotel is in a nice neighborhood, lots of eateries and shops around in the side streets.The hotel and the room looks excellent, no blemishes, impeccable cleaning. The room size is OK, tho there’s no cupboard to unload clothes -- not a problem for a one night stay. The bed is OK, not hard not soft. We had a hollywood twin, the two beds pushed together were huge.Professional photos are real, not tuned.The bathroom was not the usual japanese plastic block, but more european style. Usual japanese amenities provided.We visited Haginaka park in the afternoon with our 5 year old. Too bad that the park with vehicles that you can try closes at 5PM.Blazing fast free WIFI is provided, tho with a quirky login procedure.Our wish for a quiet room was respected. For a nice exception, reception staff spoke English quite well.We missed breakfast because of the early flight.Would return.

PROS: Just 5min-8min walk from station in a quiet and clean neighbourhood. They have clean and new facilities, stylish cafe, the rooms have a cool design, comfy beds, complete toilet facilities, outdoor slippers and indoor slippers, and best of all the laundry room was cool because you only needed 100yen for the soap and use of the machine and dryer is free!CONS: minor issue- TV was not in front of the bed but near the desk and bath so you have to watch TV while sitting in the chair but overall it was a wonderful experience :)

A very pleasant surprise for a airport hotel. We arrived very late and needed a hotel only for one night. MyStays has a free shuttle and is only a few minutes away from Haneda. Was shocked to see my room. It appeared to be brand new, was so neat and clean with everything you would want in a hotel room. The design was modern and compact but large enough to feel very comfortable. Had a very pleasant sleep and the breakfast was extensive with good mixture of Japanese and western choices. If you need a hotel at Haneda, MyStays is a great choice.

This was our first stop in Tokyo. Our flight was delayed so we landed after 1am and we were exhausted, I was so relieved to find out that our hotel was so close to the airport and only a short taxi ride away. Our room seemed newly renovated and although my initial thoughts were it was small, after staying in a few hotels throughout Japan I realised this in fact is the standard size! There were free amenities in the lobby to choose from in case you forgot anything, such as face wash. There was also tea and coffee sachets to help yourself to. The staff were friendly and helpful and their English was good and the wifi was decent :) I would absolutely stay there again!

Good economical hotel close to Haneda Airport. Very helpful staff with clean fair sized rooms you can't ask for much more.. Bus available to and from the airport with a driver that does everything to help..

If you're looking to stay at this hotel, you probably are flying out of Haneda. In that case, it's a good choice. The hotel is new and clean, and rooms decently sized. The staff themselves seemed a bit clueless though, and the attached restaurant had quite poor service.

You can either take the shuttle bus from the Airport to this hotel, or even if you take the train, the hotel is walking distance from the station. In Japan generally hotel rooms are small, however at My stay they made great use of the space.

We stay here for 1 night as we arrive at Tokyo Haneda night time and provide free shuttle bus from Haneda Airport to the Hotel. We've booked Standard Double room and the room is clean and have space for us to keep our 2 luggage without obstruct our pathway. Surroundings hotel has Family Mart (24 hours mini market) and a tourist site "Anamori Inari Shrine" in few minute walk. The next day we check out to stay at the Tokyo downtown area, we just walk to the nearby train station "Anamori Inari Station" to Shinagawa Station, it's totally convenience. I recommended this hotel for those looking nearby hotel to Haneda Airport.

We stayed here the night before we flew home and was a great location with free shuttle bus provided which took about 5-10 mins to get to the terminal. I wouldn't choose to stay here as a base for seeing Tokyo as quite far out. The room was a good size, spotlessly clean and with all the basic amenities provided. Quiet room with good air conditioning (instructions in Japanese but google helped!) and free, fast wi-fi. Staff were polite and helpful, speaking good English. We had an evening meal at the cafe which was your typical airport hotel fare. We didn't explore the local area but as a base for the airport I would definitely recommend it as excellent value for money.

Close to airport - about Y1000 in taxi from Haneda.5 min walk to train or 10 min to monorail.Rooms good size. Comfortable.Acceptable coffee in the restaurant!Not much to do close to hotel, but very easy to get into central Tokyo

This hotel is quite close to the station and is not hard to find. Basically, when you walk out the station, you will see JAL hotel in your left. After you walk to the main road, you turn right. You will see the mystays hotel sign after 15 second walk. From the station, to the hotel takes about 2-3 mins walk with luggage. The hotel is clean and quiet. The breakfast is ok too. Toyota rental car is next to the hotel. (10 seconds walk). Wifi in the room is good. There is even two speakers in the room that we could play music in the room. There is also a convenient store close by.

This hotel is good, even if it is a bit away from central Tokyo. If you have a Japan Rail Pass you can the Sky Train and walk 10 min to the hotel. There are a private line a bit closer, but it cost extra and not included in the Rail Pass. Good rooms and the breakfast is excellent.

The hotel offers a shuttle bus service but beware it has limited operating hours, early morning and late evening. Outside of that take the Keikyu line train (accessed from International terminal arrivals) two stops to Anamri inari station, then an easy 4 minute walk even with luggage.The rooms, while compact, are very cleverly designed to make use of space providing everything you need including a desk, fridge, kettle, TV and comfortable bed.The attached café offers reasonable meals, don't forget to get the discount meal voucher from reception.

Very close to Haneda airport. Shuttle service to/from airport. Hotel staff efficient at check in. Room very clean, although a bit small but for a short stay okay. Good breakfast with Japanese and Western selection. Would definitely stay again when traveling through Haneda.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel for one night after a long flight from Southeast Asia. Once we landed at Haneda, we were instructed to wait at the group bus stop for our shuttle to arrive. We sat in this little room, and every time a shuttle arrived, the driver would come into the room and announce which hotel he was with. They were all extremely helpful and told us when to expect our driver. The shuttle arrived right on time and took us to the hotel. The staff were helpful and attentive and got us checked in very quickly. The room was perfect and exceeded our expectations for the very reasonable price. For the one night we were there, we literally didn't need to open our suitcase. The room is a bit small by Western standards, but very comfortable. There were two pairs of pajamas waiting on the bed, though if you have any kind of hips, they might be a bit snug! There was a refrigerator, a huge flat screen TV, and little speakers with an auxillary cable for connecting a phone or music player (which I thought was a nice touch). The bathroom had toothpaste and toothbrushes and really nice shampoo, conditioner, and bodywash. They also provided a cabinet of further toiletries in the lobby, if you required anything else. The bed was comfortable with a memory-foam like pillow. Finally, it was within walking distance to a metro stop that we used to get to Tokyo station from where we continued our journey. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who needs a place to stay prior or post flying into/out of Haneda.

We chose this hotel because it is within our budget and it provides free shuttle service to the hotel from the airport. We reached Haneda airport around 10.30pm and by the time we are cleared from the immigration, it was closed to an hour later as it was crowded with tourist. We are glad to have chosen this hotel. The Information Center has the bus schedule.

We stayed in this hotel for the last 2 nights of our holiday before flying home from Haneda airport. We had already stayed in central Tokyo and then travelled to Kyoto and back so we were looking for a hotel that was convenient for Haneda. The hotel didn't disappoint. It is new and very clean. They provide the usual free goods including toothbrush and pyjama set and slippers. The room was adequately sized for Tokyo. There is a restaurant in the hotel although we didn't eat there - - it was 1200 yen for the breakfast buffet which isn't bad, but just a short walk away are 3 supermarkets selling croissants so we got breakfast from there instead. The 7-11 is particularly helpful as it has an ATM which allows for cash withdrawals with a foreign card! There are also some restaurants in the local area as well. The hotel is about a 3-4 minute walk from Anamori Inari station. From the station you can get into central Tokyo quite easily with your suica card (take a train to Kamata which takes about 5 minutes, change and take a train to Shingawa which takes about 7 minutes and then from there you can easily find a train to wherever you want to go in central Tokyo). On our first night we went and ate in Shibuya and the second day we visited Ueno zoo all quite easily on the train. As the route is relatively quiet we were also able to travel easily at rush hour!The hotel provide a free regular shuttle bus in the morning to the airport for guests (which is about a 7 minute drive to the international terminal). This was greatly appreciated and made getting to the airport very easy (much better than getting a train from central Tokyo in rush hour!). Although the hotel is so close to the airport, the area is really quiet and we had two good nights' sleep there.The staff are really friendly and eager to help. They speak good English. We checked onto our flights (via the hotels free wifi) and then asked the reception staff if we could print out our boarding cards which they helped with.All in all I was really impressed with the hotel. The only comment (not a criticism) I would make is that the air conditioning unit is in Japanese and there is no english guide in the hotel. We never used it as we didn't know how but thankfully the room was ambient anyway.

This hotel has relatively hughe rooms for Japanese standards ( more than 20 sqm). Everything is new and clean. Breakfast buffet ( 1200 Yen ) has Japanese as well as Western style choices.There is a free shuttle bus to and from Haneda airport, whiwh runs every 20 to 30 inutes. It is leaving the hotel direction AP between 4 am and 10,30 am.From the airport to the hotel it runs between 4 pm and 0:45 am. Stops at all 3 Haneda terminals.

I stayed there two nights because it's convenient to catch an early flight to Haneda Airport. However, it's not that easy to go to other areas in Tokyo 'cause it's only close to Keikyu private train which is not that easy to understand. When I checked in, I noticed that there's a half finished milk bottle in the fridge. The breakfast buffet is pretty good.

I been there on 22 Jan'15 and spent one night at there. Is every nice hotel everything is brand new nice room nice facility and absolutely very nice staff who can help me to access to wifi system. Honestly is too complicated to connect with hotel wifi. More important have shuttle bus service to Haneda airport. Just only one comment please put some english instruction on TV and control unit is hard for foreigner to use those unit.

It was my first time going through Haneda. I had a stopover and checked in at My Stay hotel. I took a local train, after some help from a lady I got off the 2nd stop (I believe). It was 5 minutes from the station in the direction of JAL hotel. The room was standard Japanese sized room, but very clean and comfortable. No complaints there. The restaurant downstairs served good western food, and the breakfast buffet was really sumptuous. It was all I needed.

We stayed at MyStays Haneda for 5 nights during Xmas / New Year 2014 / 2015. It was easy to find after arriving at Shinagawa on the Shinkansen from Nagoya (1 train to JR Kamata then a taxi from there or local train to the local station then a 5 min walk), the room was a comfortable size by Japanese standards, contemporary styling, immaculately clean, a comfortable bed and the bathroom was well appointed. Facilities include a restaurant on the ground floor with Japanese & western meals, a laundry room with a small lounge area adjacent if you want to wait for your laundry without returning to the room, a library room & a gym. Each floor has a room with vending machines & a microwave. We've stayed in several business hotels throughout Japan & would highly recommend this one. Only down side is that it is some distance from many sightseeing locations in Tokyo but with some assistance using the train 'system' it is manageable & we would stay there again as being so close to Haneda airport was a big bonus. The staff were very helpful, friendly and patient with our scant Japanese language skills. Highly recommended.

We chose a small double room and unfortunately we booked one of the last rooms that was available, and it was a smoking room. I don't smoke but my husband does and although this room wasn't horribly smoky when we entered it, even despite his not having smoked inside the other rooms on the floor had already begun and it was inescapable. I didn't sleep well and woke up with a terrible headache. Operator error, we should have held out for a non-smoking floor and room. I do believe though that had we gotten a non-smoking floor we'd have been far happier with our choice. There were hair bands, q-tips, clean sheets, smartly designed decor, a handy wall shelf, multiple plugs, a nice television, and the distance to the hotel is an excellent feature. This hotel is also very close to a grocery store and has vending machines. The staff were very friendly and professional despite not speaking much English and they helped me find a pharmacy to get my headache cleared up. I would stay again but as a non-smoker, certainly not in a smoking room. Everything else was great including the fast wifi!

My wife and I flew into Haneda on New Year's Eve. There were no available hotel rooms in downtown Tokyo, and Mystays was close to the airport. We expected an average, so-so hotel. We were pleasantly surprised by this new facility and large room (by Japan's standards). The train station feeding into downtown Tokyo was a few minutes away, and there is a shrine just around the corner.If you arrive late or want to be near Haneda Airport, you will not be disappointed at Mystays Haneda.

Having to depart out of Haneda after a late night arrival the evening before, I was pleasantly surprised at the efficiency and adequacy of MyStays Hotel Haneda. The hotel has a modern interior designs and nice Japanese standard bathroom equipments. The location, close to a few small fast food restaurants that opens late and about 10 minutes from the Haneda airport can not be beat. Price is about the same with the First class cabin style accomodation available at Haneda airport; which I had considered to stay at. The main difference is that you get more privacy and a bit more space at the Mystays Hotel Haneda than at the airport cabin. This hotel is definitely worth it!

review_body: By the time you ve cleared customs, its doubtful youll get public transport into the city, which makes Mystays a great choice. Easy to find the shuttle, and a decent room.... buy the breakfast when you check in for $12.

My wife and I picked Hotel MyStays Haneda knowing that we were going to be arriving late from Vancouver BC and we didnt feel like rushing into Tokyo Center late that evening. This hotel was absolutely perfect for a late arrival or early morning departure from Tokyo International. The hotel is about a 10 minute (and $10 USD) cab ride if you miss the shuttle, so not bad at all. The next morning, we went back to the airport, via the free Hotel MyStays shuttle to catch the monorail and the the JR in to Shinjuku (make sure you buy your JR passes BEFORE you arrive in Tokyo). Tokyo central was about 50 minutes from the Haneda Airport. From the monorail, you have to transfer to the JR...it was really easy.The room was great, very NYC or San Francisco-esq. On the smallish side but the hotel is very new and there was not anything we were missing. WiFi in room was free, blow dryer, even pajamas on the bed when we walked in!! The MyStay has a restaurant in the lobby for breakfast - roughly $18 USD all you can eat buffet. We enjoyed it very much.The staff here was very helpful, many speak decent broken English....we had no problem figuring out what we needed to do. ARIGATO! If I ever have a late arrival or early departure again from Tokyo Haneda, I would absolutely stay here again.

LocationLocated in the town of Haneda. From the airport there is a free shuttle link every 10 past and 40 past the hour- but only from domestic terminals 1 & 2 if after 1pm. From International terminal, it is fairly easy to transfer to domestic terminals for free with terminal buses. There is a frequent shuttle service though in the AM from hotel to all terminals- see photo for times. In the immediate vicinity is a train station that can take you into Tokyo say to Shibuya in less than 1 hour. There is also many small Japanese restaurants and a Mcdonalds although that is about 20 minutes walk away. Lawsons and other mini marts though are within walking distance. Overall the area is quite nice.Room The room on the second floor was quite compact but cosy with a functional layout. As you enter you get a living room space with a small thin armchair with foot rest that faces a large TV. The TV is multifunctional with many movies in the "room theatre" mode costing about 1000Y for all. There is though some local and international TV such as CNN. As well as handy shuttle service and flight information screens. Although DVD was not present, noticed you can hire one. The room also had a large functional desk that backs off the bed posts. A lamp, phone, mini speakers, Pad, mirror & plenty of US plug slots are all on the desk. It a good size with a comfortable chair to work. This backs on to the queen sized bed quite firm but not uncomfortable- there are convenient dimming lamps either side of bed. Three kinds of pillow are offered, one of which is a memory foam ergonomic pillow. The room also offer s fridge, pyjamas, slippers, large safe, kettle and tea making facilities, portable luggage rack, open wardrobe with even clothes fragrance spray. Very functional room for an airport hotel but you cannot watch TV in bed, since the TV is behind the bed. The bathroom was typical of Japan, poky but functional offering a Japanese washlet, deep but small bath and shower on raised platform. All amenities are large bottles and quite nice products, dental kits is also offered. Overall the room was better than expected, there only thing for international travellers is the A/C unit is only in Japanese so found it hard to use when one cannot read Japanese. Considering they have very clear guides in English such as for WIFI, they should consider something helpful in English for AC unit as I found it cold and then fiddled about and the room became too hot. FacilitiesThe hotel has quite a good standard of facilities. Firstly WIFI is free and worked fast. There is a cafe/bar in the lobby but did not use, plenty of vending & ice machines on each floor. On the top floor is a small gym, the floor down is a 'Relaxing room" with a few massage chairs and TV's but always occupied when I visited. There is also a laundry room, smoking room (room's are all non smoking) & meeting rooms. The whole hotel is absolutely spotlessly clean and modern. StaffStaff are very enthusiastic at this hotel, noticeably more welcoming than JAL hotel I stayed at previously which is across the street- even when you pop out they make effort to say 'welcome back' when you walk in lobby. Check-in and check out was very smooth and the shuttle service is extremely efficient with really professional staff that take pride in their roles. Overall I think this is one of the best hotels I have stayed at in Japan. I generally only have stayed at airport hotels but was very impressed and would certainly come here again on my next stay at Hanaeda.

We stayed here after a 12 hour flight from the US. Free Shuttle was nice and it was easy to find with the directions printed off the hotels website. Shuttle ride was about 10 minutes. The room was very clean and they had free wi-fi. Our luggage was lost so it was nice they had pjs to sleep in and a lot of available free toiletries (toothbrushes, combs, razors etc) in the lobby we could use. The hotel just opened September 2014. There were several areas to lounge in including a library and room with free massage chairs. English was easily understood.The breakfast buffet was decent the next morning and had a lot food options including fruit, cereal, rice, rice porridge, salad bar, many juice choices, coffee & tea etc.There isn't a lot near the hotel as far as tourist attractions. This is more of a good place to stay before or after a flight at Haneda.

Our first time trying this hotel chain and we were not dissapointed at all. It went beyond our expectations. We waited for the shuttle as instructed on their website (note: same area were airlines picked their crew. There is not a designated spot or sign for their shuttle but they parked at the end of the row and the driver asks around looking for guests). Check-in was easy and friendly. Rooms are new, impecably clean and even though they are small, they do have all you could need including nice speakers for your IPod/IPhone. The decoration was modern and minimalist (our fave style), pillows were perfect and it was really quiet, so we had a good rest. We didn't get breakfast there so I can't review that part. After checked out we walked to the train station a few blocks from there. A little hard to find since its in between small streets and also small station, but from there to Tokyo was a blink of an eye. All in all, an excellent price and value. It's marked as one of our places to return back. Congrats to the chain.

Short review because I only stayed here for a day but the hotel is a very new hotel and it shows. The hotel has a massage chair room with aromatherapy, a gym and meeting room. Don't listen to the other reviews, rooms are BIG for Tokyo hotels. And location is near haneda.

We stay at this hotel because we have to take an early flight in the next morning, the hotel is nice, clean and comfortable, only one thing is the staff can't speak english and keep silent, but they are nice and always smiling.Location is very convenience, just 2 minutes walk from metro station, surrounded by many local small restaurant.Valued hotel with excellent location makes me to stay again when we come to Tokyo next month.

My family and I arrived at the Tokyo Haneda Airport around midnight and I was very glad that the hotel was just five minutes away by taxi. We planned our tour of Tokyo using Haneda Airport as the jump off point and we enjoyed the hotel's free shuttle to and from the airport. And in case you missed the shuttle, a train station was just a seven minute walk behind the hotel. So the hotel was not only convenient. It was clean and comfortable as well. Amenities were plentiful and the staff was friendly. The rooms were quite small but this is very normal for Japanese standards. Definitely a value for money hotel I would say.

Great shiny new hotel near the airport with free shuttle morning and night (not much afternoon). Decent size room at reasonable price with gym and decent breakfast downstairs (expensive to what you could find outside but easy).

I stayed at this hotel overnight, which is for the purpose of this place considering the location. Very close to the international terminal. The room is quite small but the reception arranged a cab for me to catch a flight in the early morning. It's just a couple of minutes away. There are a couple of conveniences stores very close by. Nothing else but very convenient for an early flight.

I only stayed here for a night. I had to catch an early morning flight back to Hong Kong, so I decided to stay close to Haneda Airport. It was a great choice! The hotel is located only a few blocks away from a metro stop and it is surrounded by small restaurants and convenience stores. It is small and cozy and have a cafe-bar at the lobby. They offer a free shuttle every 30 minutes to Haneda. Rooms are small, but tidy. You get a complimentary set of pijamas, shampoo/conditioner (my hair smelled great next day!), great wifi connection, TV with basic Japanese channels and a few international networks, toiletries, hair-dryer, etc. It's very convenient if you have to catch a flight or work close to Haneda. If you plan to visit Tokyo it is far away from the city. I'd definitely recommend it to a friend!
